0.title: I wake up in disbelief that this is my life, that I'm an actor: Ranveer Singh
0.article_body: Actor Ranveer Singh has said, "I'm...grateful that I get to be an actor and that's actually enough for me." "I've always said...it's a miracle that I even became an actor," he added. "Every day, I wake up in disbelief that this is my life, that I'm an actor and I get to do these things, collaborate with...talented filmmakers," Ranveer said.

1.title: Anyone chosen as Cong Prez by consensus acceptable to G-23: Chavan
1.article_body: Congress leader Prithviraj Chavan said a party President chosen by consensus would be acceptable to the G-23 dissenters. He said the President could be Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot or any leader if chosen by general agreement. He also backed Shashi Tharoor's demand to make public the electoral rolls of the Congress President polls to be held on October 17.

2.title: Brendan Fraser breaks down as The Whale gets 6-min standing ovation at film fest
2.article_body: Actor Brendan Fraser, known for 'The Mummy' films, broke into tears after his film 'The Whale' received a six-minute-long standing ovation at Venice Film Festival 2022. The film, directed by Darren Aronofsky, features Brendan as a 600-pound (over 270 kg) gay professor who tries to reconnect with his 17-year-old daughter. The film was screened at the festival on September 4.

3.title: Windfall tax on petroleum products, crude isn't ad hoc: Sitharaman
3.article_body: Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Monday said windfall tax on petroleum products and crude is not ad hoc. She said that it's being charged in regular consultation with the industry. The tax rate and its resetting are done in complete consultations with the industry, she said, adding, "The very idea was implemented after taking the industry into full confidence."

4.title: Film will be new & fresh: Ayan on fans' concern on 'Brahmastra' promos
4.article_body: 'Brahmastra: Part One-Shiva' makers have been sharing new promos of the film ahead of its release, which has left the fans concerned. On Monday, Ayan Mukerji addressed the fans' concerns and told them not to worry as the film will be "new and fresh" on screen. He assured fans that the "actual movie is a whole other experience".

5.title: Didn't get India's team selection or playing style: Shoaib Akhtar
5.article_body: Former Pakistani bowler Shoaib Akhtar said he is "confused" with India's team selection and manner of playing. "India's team came across a very confusing selection for me...whoever is coming, is just hitting...someone has to anchor the innings," said Akhtar. He added that after Pakistan's first match loss, he had told everyone that they would beat India "ruthlessly" next time.

6.title: Nuclear-capable US bombers fly over Middle East amid tensions with Iran
6.article_body: Amid tensions between Washington and Tehran, the US said that a pair of its nuclear-capable B-52 long-distance bombers made a sortie over the Middle East on Sunday. The bombers took off from an airbase in England and flew over the eastern Mediterranean, the Arabian Peninsula and the Red Sea with Saudi and Kuwaiti warplanes as part of a training mission.

7.title: I want to generate jobs, but some are obstructing by filing PILs: Mamata
7.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee said that she wants to "generate jobs" for the aspirants of the School Service Commission (SSC) but some people are "obstructing" the process and filing PILs for the same. "Some people want to politicise the matter and are filing PILs to stop the process. If you file cases, the process will take time," she said.

8.title: Kanye was upset that I supported Joe Biden over him as President: John Legend
8.article_body: Singer John Legend said Kanye West was "very upset" with him after he supported Joe Biden over him in the 2020 US presidential election. Kanye announced his presidential election campaign in July 2020. In reference to his friendship with Ye, John said he believes that "relationships with people shouldn't only be determined by who they voted for".

9.title: Hope Lewandowski can win the Ballon d'Or in 2022: Puyol
9.article_body: Ex-Barcelona captain Carles Puyol said he hopes Robert Lewandowski can win the Ballon d'Or this year. "He deserves it for the good years he has had and now he has to win it at Barcelona. It'll be a good sign," he added. "He's one of the best strikers in...world," he further said. Barcelona signed Lewandowski from Bayern Munich in July.

10.title: Will shave my beard after 8 years if I win 2nd World Cup: France's Giroud
10.article_body: France forward Oliver Giroud said he would "have to do something a little crazy" and shave his beard if he won the World Cup for the second time. "It's been a long time, it's been almost eight years," said Giroud about shaving his beard. Defending champions France will open their 2022 FIFA World Cup campaign on November 22 against Australia.

11.title: Revenue-based financing firm Klub closes ₹200 cr maiden fund
11.article_body: Revenue-based financing platform Klub announced the final close of its maiden ₹200 crore fund, Aceler8. It is a SEBI-registered Category II Alternative Investment Fund and has already deployed 30% of its corpus. The fund invests capital between ₹5 lakh to ₹30 crore in businesses for up to 24 months and has made 33 investments over the last few months.

12.title: Had no money to celebrate b'day when I was young, now I've no desire: Pankaj
12.article_body: Pankaj Tripathi, who turned 46 on Monday, remembered that when he was young, he didn't have money to enjoy his special day. Now, when he can afford to celebrate his birthday, Tripathi said he has no desire to make noise. "The age to enjoy birthdays is gone," he said, adding, "A quiet day with the family is all I want."

13.title: India are playing good cricket: SL captain Shanaka ahead of Asia Cup game
13.article_body: Ahead of India-Sri Lanka Super 4 stage match of Asia Cup 2022, Sri Lanka skipper Dasun Shanaka said India have been playing good cricket. "They (India) had a great game last night...I don't think they will be under pressure," he added. The match will be played on Tuesday. Sri Lanka are currently on top of the Super 4 points table.

14.title: Healthledger Diagnostics raises undisclosed amount of seed funding
14.article_body: Healthledger Diagnostics has raised an undisclosed amount of seed funding from angel investors and venture capitalists. The transactions were enabled by Quadra Capital Advisors and include VCs Nitish Mittersain and Vikash Mittersain of Nazara Technologies and lifestyle coach Luke Coutinho, among others, the company said. The firm claims to have generated $1 million revenue in its inception year.

15.title: Central govt provide armed CISF cover to RSS offices in Delhi
15.article_body: The RSS offices in Delhi have been provided with an armed Central Industrial Security Force cover by the Central government. According to PTI, the organisation's main 'Keshav Kunj' office located at Jhandewalan and its camp office located nearby at 'Udasin Ashram' have been brought under the CISF cover beginning September 1. Notably, the cover was sanctioned by the Home Ministry.

16.title: Court not a tool for your resume: HC to student who sought ₹15 lakh over pollution in Delhi
16.article_body: Dismissing his petition seeking grant of ₹15-lakh compensation from the government on the ground of air pollution in Delhi, the High Court told a law student that the right to file a case before the court is not merely a tool for resume. "Sir remember, the court is a serious place," Justice Yashwant Varma told the petitioner.

17.title: Can students wear minis in colleges?: SC while hearing plea against hijab ban
17.article_body: Supreme Court Justice Hemant Gupta asked if students were allowed to dress in "minis, midis, whatever they want" in colleges while hearing a plea challenging the ban on hijab in government colleges in Karnataka. The apex court bench said, "They (authorities) are not denying the right to education. What they are saying as State, is you come in the uniform."

18.title: Jaffer, Mishra troll Barmy Army for calling Ashes bigger than India-Pakistan rivalry
18.article_body: Wasim Jaffer and Amit Mishra trolled England's Barmy Army for tweeting, "Ashes > India vs Pakistan anyway." Jaffer wrote, "If I was an England fan, with the Ashes record England has, I'd downplay the Ashes if anything." Meanwhile, Mishra posted a picture of Russian President Vladimir Putin and ex-England captain Nasser Hussain and wrote, "Difference between #IndvsPak & Ashes."

19.title: You inspire me so much: Kriti Sanon on Pankaj Tripathi's birthday
19.article_body: Actress Kriti Sanon on Monday wished Pankaj Tripathi on his birthday. Taking to her Instagram Stories, she wrote, "Happy Birthday Pankaj Sir! You inspire me so much...Have done a few of my best films with you and I hope I get to do many more!" The duo have worked together in films like 'Bachchhan Paandey', 'Mimi' and 'Bareilly Ki Barfi'.

20.title: SRK's Red Chillies acquires remake rights of 'Dulhe Raja': Reports
20.article_body: Shah Rukh Khan's Red Chillies Entertainment has reportedly acquired the negative and remake rights of 1998 film 'Dulhe Raja'. As per reports, director Farhad Samji is working on the script of the film. "If the screenplay is faithful adaptation and actors show keen interest, Red Chillies will be more than happy to remake the film," a source informed Pinkvilla.

21.title: Can’t expect govt to provide security to pvt hospitals: Supreme Court
21.article_body: Supreme Court on Monday said it can't be expected from the central and state governments to provide security to private hospitals. It was hearing a plea seeking direction to the government to ensure adequate security at hospitals to prevent attacks on doctors. "The private centres must make their own security arrangement. You cannot burden the government," the court said.

22.title: Fans get emotional and say a few words, we don't have a problem: Arshdeep Singh's father
22.article_body: Talking about his son getting abused on social media for dropping a catch against Pakistan in Asia Cup, India pacer Arshdeep Singh's father Darshan Singh said, "Fans get emotional, angry when their team loses and say a few words." He added, "We're taking it positively and there's no problem." "People have a habit to say...let them say," Arshdeep's mother said.

23.title: Instagram fined $400 million by Ireland for violating children's privacy
23.article_body: Meta-owned Instagram has been fined €405 million (around $402 million) for allegedly violating children's privacy, including the publication of children's email addresses and phone numbers. The fine has been levied by the Irish DPC and is the second highest fine under the EU's General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR). Instagram is the third Meta-owned company fined by the Irish DPC.

24.title: Ricky Ponting names his 5 players for World T20I XI
24.article_body: Ex-Australia captain Ricky Ponting has named the first five players he would choose in his world T20I XI. He included Afghanistan's Rashid Khan, Pakistan's Babar Azam, India's Hardik Pandya and Jasprit Bumrah, and England's Jos Buttler. "Right now he's probably the best all-rounder in the world in T20 cricket, and could potentially be in ODI cricket," Ponting said about Pandya.

25.title: 2 dead, many missing after boat with 23 fishermen capsizes in Kerala
25.article_body: Two fishermen were killed and many went missing after a boat carrying about 23 people capsized near Anchuthengu Harbour in Kerala's Thiruvananthapuram on Monday. According to police, 16 people have been rescued so far. The injured were shifted to Chirayinkeezhu hospital for treatment. The Indian Coast Guard and locals are searching for the missing persons.

26.title: 19-year-old Palestinian man shot dead by Israeli forces
26.article_body: A 19-year-old Palestinian man was killed in a clash with Israeli forces that broke out during an arrest raid in West Bank on Monday, Palestinian officials said. Israeli military said that its soldiers resorted to retaliatory firing after the man threw a firebomb at troops from close range. Militant group Islamic Jihad claimed that the deceased was one its members.

27.title: Journalist Shireen Abu Akleh likely killed by soldier: Israeli army
27.article_body: The Israeli army on Monday announced the results of its investigation into the killing of Palestinian-American journalist Shireen Abu Akleh, saying it was "highly possible" that she was killed by an Israeli soldier's gunfire. However, no one would be punished as the shooting was accidental, army added. Akleh was killed in May while covering a military raid in West Bank.

28.title: India's monetary policy will remain watchful, calibrated: RBI Guv
28.article_body: Reserve Bank of India (RBI) Governor Shaktikanta Das on Monday said that India's monetary policy will remain watchful, nimble-footed and calibrated going forward. He further said India's central bank has intervened in forex markets to prevent excessive volatility in the exchange rate. He noted that the Indian rupee had moved in an orderly manner during sharp depreciations in other currencies.

29.title: Football-size tumour removed from Nepalese woman's stomach in Delhi
29.article_body: A football-size tumour, weighing around four kg, was removed from the stomach of a 32-year-old woman from Nepal at a private hospital in Delhi. The woman had come to the hospital with complaints of extreme pain and an oversized stomach. A doctor said that removing the tumour was like delivering a large size baby as in a caesarean section.

30.title: Mastercard replaces Paytm as BCCI's title sponsor for 2022-23 season
30.article_body: Global payments giant Mastercard has replaced Paytm as the title sponsor of the Board of Control for Cricket in India. Mastercard has announced that it has acquired the BCCI's title sponsorship rights for all international (both women and men) and domestic matches for the 2022-23 season. Notably, Paytm held the rights for seven years as the title sponsor of BCCI.

31.title: Wimbledon finalist Jabeur reaches her first-ever quarter-final at US Open
31.article_body: Wimbledon finalist Ons Jabeur defeated 18th seed Veronika Kudermetova 7-6(7-1), 6-4 in the fourth round to enter her maiden quarter-final at US Open. "It was a very difficult match," said Jabeur. Notably, the Tunisian became the first Arab woman to reach the last eight in New York. Jabeur will now face Ajla Tomljanovic, who beat Liudmila Samsonova 7-6(10-8), 6-1.

32.title: Platforms like Twitter can't decide what is free speech: Centre to HC
32.article_body: The Centre told the High Court on Thursday that intermediary platforms like Twitter can't "define what free speech is and what's not". Twitter's petition challenging action against multiple handles is not maintainable, the Centre said while adding that Twitter's content management policies are "a failure". Twitter isn't taking effective steps to prevent the spread of fake news, the Centre said.

33.title: We have left behind those who ruled us for 250 years: PM Modi
33.article_body: As India surpassed the UK to become the fifth-largest economy, Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Monday said, "Achieving this spot is special as we have left behind those who ruled over us for 250 years." The PM was interacting with National Award-winning teachers. "Our new National Education Policy (NEP) is being applauded throughout the world," PM Modi added.

34.title: Vijay Deverakonda's 'Jana Gana Mana' shelved following Liger's box office failure: Report
34.article_body: Following Liger's box office failure, Vijay Deverakonda's next film 'Jana Gana Mana', which was also to be directed by Puri Jagannadh, has been shelved, Hindustan Times reported. As per trade sources, Liger managed to earn just ₹35 crore across India in its opening weekend. Earlier, it was announced that 'Jana Gana Mana' will be released in August 2023.

35.title: Odisha Juggernauts win the inaugural edition of Ultimate Kho Kho
35.article_body: Odisha Juggernauts won the title at the inaugural edition of Ultimate Kho Kho after beating Telugu Yoddhas 46-45 in the final in Pune on Sunday. Odisha Juggernauts were awarded ₹1 crore in prize money, while the second-placed Telugu Yoddhas won ₹50 lakh. Gujarat Giants bagged ₹30 lakh for their third-place finish.

36.title: Can't you see it's a throwback photo, chomu aadmi: Sanjana to troll over pic with Bumrah
36.article_body: Team India fast bowler Jasprit Bumrah's wife, TV presenter Sanjana Ganesan, responded to a troll who commented on her Instagram picture with Bumrah. "Waha India ki *** ***** pade hue hai or yeh gum rahe," the troll wrote, mocking Bumrah for not being in India squad for Asia Cup. Sanjana responded, "It's a throwback photo, can't you see, chomu aadmi?"

37.title: He looked very good: Gambhir on Kohli's 60 vs Pakistan at Asia Cup
37.article_body: Commenting on India batter Virat Kohli's 44-ball 60 against Pakistan in Super 4 stage match at Asia Cup 2022, Gautam Gambhir said, "Kohli looked very, very good." He added, "Kohli...coming back after the way he batted in...first and second game just showed that probably he got that confidence back especially today." It was Kohli's second consecutive half-century in the tournament.

38.title: 60-80% Twitter accounts posting on Russia-Ukraine war may be bots: Study
38.article_body: A research by scholars from Australia's University of Adelaide has revealed that between 60-80% of Twitter handles posting on the Russia-Ukraine war may be bot accounts. These bot accounts may have been pushing people to flee their homes during the conflict, the research said. Of accounts tweeting on the war, 90.16% were "pro Ukraine" while only 6.8% were "pro Russia".

39.title: Tonight you saw, rankings don't matter: Kyrgios on beating world no. 1 Medvedev
39.article_body: After defeating world number one and defending champion Daniil Medvedev in the fourth round at US Open 2022, world number 25 Nick Kyrgios said, "Tonight was another message that the rankings don't matter." He added, "I don't care whether I'm seeded or not. It's nice otherwise I could draw him [in] first round." Kyrgios beat Medvedev 7-6(13-11), 3-6, 6-3, 6-2.

40.title: India's external debt grew by 8.2% in 2021-22: Finance Ministry
40.article_body: India's external debt grew by 8.2% to $620.70 billion on March 31, 2022, from $573.7 billion a year ago, Union Finance Ministry said. External debt as a ratio to GDP fell marginally to 19.9% at the end of March 2022, it added. Foreign currency reserves as a ratio to external debt stood slightly lower at 97.8% as of March-end 2022.

41.title: India to design, build reusable rocket for global market: ISRO
41.article_body: India has plans to design and build a new reusable rocket for the global market, that would significantly cut the cost of launching satellites, a senior Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO) official said on Monday. “All of us want launches to be much cheaper than what we do today,” ISRO Chairman S Somanath further said.

42.title: 14,500 schools to be developed, upgraded: PM Modi on Teachers' Day
42.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on the occasion of Teachers' Day on Monday announced that 14,500 schools across India will be developed and upgraded under the Pradhan Mantri Schools For Rising India (PM-SHRI) Yojana. "These will become model schools which will encapsulate the full spirit of [National Education Policy]," he said. These will put emphasis on a discovery-oriented, learning-centric way of teaching.

43.title: American filmmaker Gunn reacts to Chiranjeevi's 'Mr Batman' avatar in old song
43.article_body: American filmmaker James Gunn, known for films like 'Guardians of the Galaxy' and 'The Suicide Squad', has shared a video of a song from Chiranjeevi's 1993 Telugu film 'Mutamestri'. In the video shared by Gunn, the actor could be seen dancing in a Batman costume. "First there was Batman, then The Batman, and now MR. BATMAN," Gunn wrote.

44.title: Aamir Khan's brother Faissal Khan rejects 'Bigg Boss 16'
44.article_body: Actor Faissal Khan, brother of Aamir Khan, took to Instagram to share a video revealing that he was approached for Salman Khan's 'Bigg Boss 16' but he rejected the offer. He added that he was also offered a TV show. "I'm quite excited...people are...considering me. Please pray for me...I get some good work so I can...entertain you all," said Faissal.

45.title: Bihar's political upheaval unlikely to have nationwide impact: Prashant Kishor
45.article_body: Political strategist Prashant Kishor on Monday said that the political upheaval in Bihar, which saw JD(U) breaking its alliance with BJP, was a "state-specific" phenomenon and is unlikely to have a nationwide effect. Kishor added that the upheaval was symbolic of the "political instability" that has plagued Bihar since the rise of the "new BJP" under PM Narendra Modi's leadership.

46.title: 11-yr-old missing boy found dead inside a madrasa in Haryana
46.article_body: An 11-year-old boy was found dead inside a madrasa in Shah Chaukha village in Haryana's Nuh district. The deceased, Sameer, went missing from the same Madrasa on Saturday and police recovered his decomposed body from an old room. Half of the deceased's body was covered with sand, the complaint said. Sameer was staying and studying in the madrasa since 2021.

47.title: Free power supply to all farmers if non-BJP govt comes in 2024: KCR
47.article_body: Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao on Monday announced "free power supply to all farmers in the country if a non-BJP government comes to power in 2024". He was speaking at a public meeting in Nizamabad. Days ago at another event, Rao had called for "BJP-mukt Bharat". He had said the BJP was responsible for all major problems afflicting the country.

48.title: Indian Army chief Gen Pande made honorary General of Nepali Army
48.article_body: Indian Army chief General Manoj Pande was conferred the honorary rank of "General of the Nepali Army" by Nepal's President Bidya Devi Bhandari on Monday. The practice follows the seven-decade-old tradition between India and Nepal where both countries confer the title of honorary General to each other's army chiefs. General Pande is currently on a five-day official visit to Nepal.

49.title: India's services sector PMI grows from 4-month low to 57.2 in Aug
49.article_body: India's services sector saw improvement in August from a four-month low Purchasing Managers' Index in July. The S&P Global India Services PMI rose to 57.2 in August from July's 55.5. "Business confidence strengthened substantially, reaching its highest since May 2018, while employment rose at...fastest pace in over 14 years," Pollyanna De Lima, Economics Associate Director at S&P Global said.

50.title: Delhi L-G sends legal notice to Atishi, other AAP leaders for defamation
50.article_body: Delhi Lieutenant Governor Vinai Kumar Saxena on Monday sent a legal notice to AAP leaders, including MLAs Atishi and Saurabh Bharadwaj, for levelling "derogatory" charges against him. Earlier, AAP had alleged that Saxena pressured his employees to exchange demonetised notes worth ₹1,400 crore in 2016 when he was chairman of a government Khadi body. AAP demanded his resignation and arrest.

51.title: MP woman fights off tiger, saves 15-month-old son from its jaws
51.article_body: A woman in her 20s repeatedly hit a tiger with her bare hands to save her 15-month-old son in the Bandhavgarh Tiger Reserve in Madhya Pradesh's Umaria district, officials said on Monday. The tiger, that had held the child by its jaws, later mauled the woman, who sustained a fracture to her neck. Some villagers reportedly chased away the tiger.

52.title: Messi, Mbappe, Neymar need to accept that they won't play all games: PSG coach
52.article_body: PSG coach Christophe Galtier said that the club's players, including Lionel Messi, Kylian Mbappe and Neymar, will have to sit out from the matches at times. "We play a lot, every three days, then every four days, then there is the World Cup. Everyone has to understand that they won't be able to play all the games," Galtier said.

53.title: Bihar teacher harasses student for rejecting proposal, made to do sit-ups
53.article_body: A video has gone viral from Bihar, which shows villagers forcing a teacher to do sit-ups after he proposed a girl student that he used to teach. According to reports, the girl took tuition from him and rejected his proposal when the accused made advances. The accused started eve-teasing and harassing her, following which he was made to do sit-ups.

54.title: Kenya's top court upholds William Ruto's election as president
54.article_body: Kenya's Supreme Court on Monday unanimously upheld the election of William Ruto as the country's president in the August 9 polls. Runner-up candidate Raila Odinga had challenged Ruto's victory in the top court, alleging ballot rigging and other irregularities. Two affidavits alleging tampering with polling station result forms were dismissed by the court as "double hearsay".

55.title: Aakash Chopra changes his Twitter DP in support of Arshdeep who got abused for catch drop
55.article_body: Cricketer-turned-commentator Aakash Chopra changed his Twitter DP to that of Arshdeep Singh's photo to support the Team India fast bowler, who got abused on social media for dropping a catch against Pakistan in Asia Cup. Earlier, the Indian government summoned executives of Wikipedia after Arshdeep's page information was changed to reflect an association with Khalistan.

56.title: 7 killed in Hungary after train collides with car
56.article_body: A train collided with a car at a level crossing in southern Hungary on Monday, killing all seven occupants of the car, local authorities said. According to police, the driver of the train was rushed to a hospital with minor injuries. The level crossing where the incident took place had no gate or electric signal, Hungary's state railway company said.

57.title: Delhi's historic Rajpath & Central Vista lawns renamed 'Kartavya Path' by govt
57.article_body: Centre on Monday announced that the Rajpath (formerly 'Kingsway') and Central Vista lawns area in New Delhi will be renamed 'Kartavya Path'. Rajpath is the boulevard that runs from the Rashtrapati Bhawan through Vijay Chowk and India Gate, National War Memorial to National Stadium. This comes days ahead of the scheduled reopening of the refurbished Central Vista on September 8.

58.title: PayU's acquisition of BillDesk for $4.7 billion approved by CCI
58.article_body: The Competition Commission of India (CCI) has approved the $4.7-billion acquisition of payment gateway BillDesk by Prosus' PayU. It is said to be the largest acquisition in India's digital payments space. The acquisition was announced in August last year. With the deal, PayU will now operate in more than 20 markets.

59.title: Well done girls, you are so amazing: SRK on his team TKR winning women's CPL
59.article_body: Bollywood actor Shah Rukh Khan congratulated his team, Trinbago Knight Riders, for lifting the trophy of the Women's Caribbean Premier League on Sunday. "Every victory is special...but somehow this one for TKR women's squad is well, most special. Well done girls you are all so beautiful and amazing," SRK tweeted. Notably, the actor owns TKR and KKR cricket teams.

60.title: 2 killed in flash flood in Kerala, IMD issues red alert in 4 districts
60.article_body: Two persons, including an eight-year-old girl, died in a flash flood at Mankayam waterfalls in Kerala's Palode town on Sunday, said police. They were a part of a group of 10 people. Meanwhile, the India Meteorological Department (IMD) issued a red alert in four districts including, Thiruvananthapuram, Kollam, Pathanamthitta and Idukki, for Tuesday.

61.title: SpiceJet needs ₹2,000 crore to continue flying: Report
61.article_body: Budget carrier SpiceJet needs recapitalisation to keep flying and compete with existing and new airlines, industry watchers reportedly told Livemint. The airline has reportedly said that its board had approved raising up to ₹2,000 crore amid high fuel prices and depreciation of the rupee. Notably, SpiceJet on Wednesday posted a worse-than-expected net loss of ₹789 crore for the April-June quarter.

62.title: 4 including 4-yr-old electrocuted to death in Assam; 2 others hurt
62.article_body: Four persons, including a four-year-old child, were electrocuted to death in Assam's Hailakandi district on Sunday evening. According to police, the incident took place when the child touched a live electric wire fallen on the ground and his parents and neighbours rushed to save him, but also got electrocuted in the process. Two others have sustained injuries in the incident.

63.title: Kerala tattoo artist accused of rape, sexual assault reopens studio
63.article_body: Tattoo artist Sujeesh PS, who had been arrested on March 5 after several women accused him of sexual abuse and rape, has reopened his tattoo studio 'Inkfected' in Kerala's Kochi. At least six women filed sexual assault complaints against him after an 18-year-old girl, in an anonymous post on Reddit, alleged she was raped in the tattoo studio by him.

64.title: 'Baahubali' was very similar to 'Karan Arjun': Rakesh Roshan
64.article_body: Filmmaker Rakesh Roshan said in an interview that SS Rajamouli's 'Baahubali' was "very similar" to his 1995 film 'Karan Arjun'. "But it was presented on a bigger scale. Even...songs were larger-than-life and hence people were enticed," he added. "In...South, they're still sticking to rooted stories," he said, adding that Bollywood filmmakers have "drifted away from the roots of Indianness".

65.title: Hope we play like this only: Nawaz on Pakistan's 5-wicket win vs India
65.article_body: Pakistan all-rounder Muhammad Nawaz said he hopes that the team will continue to play as they performed in their five-wicket win against India in the Super 4 stage match of Asia Cup 2022 on Sunday. Nawaz was adjudged 'Player of the Match' for his 42 runs and 1/25. Pakistan chased the 182-run target on the penultimate ball of the match.

66.title: 2 policemen injured in accidental firing at training centre in Himachal
66.article_body: An Assistant Sub-Inspector (ASI) and a Head Constable suffered injuries after a gun was accidentally fired at the Police Training College in Himachal Pradesh's Kangra district on Sunday. The victims are instructors at the centre. "A bullet got stuck in a gun during firing training. The two instructors were trying to fix it when the weapon misfired," said an official.

67.title: Aditi Rao Hydari shares pic with Mani Ratnam on Teachers' Day, pens note
67.article_body: Actress Aditi Rao Hydari took to Instagram on Monday to share a picture with filmmaker Mani Ratnam on the occasion of Teachers' Day. She wrote, "Be curious, admit mistakes, learn, evolve...Know whom to listen to and what to absorb and what to discard!" "To every teacher I've had every step of the way, Happy Teachers' day," Aditi added.

68.title: Society chairman, a Dawood associate, is threatening us: Malad residents
68.article_body: Residents of a high-rise building in Mumbai's Malad have written to the police requesting a suo moto case against the society's chairman. The residents claimed chairman Sonu Jalan has been threatening them, insulting women and misappropriating society funds. Residents say they are afraid of filing a case by themselves as Jalan is allegedly a close associate of Dawood Ibrahim.

69.title: Prez Murmu walks down the podium to honour differently-abled teacher, video goes viral
69.article_body: While conferring National Awards to teachers on the occasion of Teachers' Day, President Droupadi Murmu walked down the podium to honour a differently-abled teacher. Sharing a video, Union Minister Dharmendra Pradhan tweeted, "This heartwarming gesture...is a sweet reminder of her humility, rootedness and compassion. President Murmu is an inspiration when it comes to ideal public values."

70.title: Rape survivor fails 'virginity test' in Rajasthan, fined ₹10 lakh by Khap Panchayat
70.article_body: A 24-year-old woman was allegedly tortured, beaten and forced to undergo a 'virginity test' on the first day of her marriage in Rajasthan's Bhilwara. A ₹10 lakh penalty was also imposed on the rape survivor by the Khap Panchayat after she failed the test. Despite knowing about the rape, the woman's father-in-law made her go through the humiliation, said police.

71.title: Waste dumped in Navi Mumbai mangroves rising: Activists to Maha CM
71.article_body: Environmentalists have written to Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde about the waste accumulated in Navi Mumbai mangroves. The letter sought stringent penalties and imprisonment for repeat offenders stating that medical waste, including syringes, has been found in the mangroves. Environmentalists say despite a dozen NGOs working on clean-up drives, the amount of waste keeps increasing.

72.title: India hands over body of terrorist, who died of cardiac arrest, to Pak
72.article_body: The body of a fidayeen suicide attacker from PoK, who was captured by Indian Army during an infiltration attempt in Jammu and Kashmir, has been handed over to Pakistan. The 32-year-old terrorist, identified as Tabarak Hussain, was injured in Army firing during his infiltration attempt and later he died of cardiac arrest on Saturday. He's reportedly a trained Lashkar-e-Taiba terrorist.

73.title: Pakistan's Muhammad Rizwan to undergo MRI scan for right leg strain
73.article_body: Pakistan wicketkeeper-batter Muhammad Rizwan will undergo a precautionary MRI scan today after sustaining a strain in his right leg during the five-wicket win over India in the Super 4 stage of Asia Cup 2022 on Sunday. The 30-year-old was reportedly shifted to a hospital soon after Pakistan’s last-over victory. Rizwan scored a match-winning 51-ball 71 against India.

74.title: My body made me beauty queen & mother, gotta love it both ways: Neha
74.article_body: Actress Neha Dhupia said people's opinion on her body doesn't upset her because it gave her "two amazing humans", daughter Mehr and son Guriq. "This body made me a beauty queen and this body made me a mother. I gotta love it both ways," she said. She added she wants to set "realistic standards for myself and everyone else".

75.title: PM Modi congratulates Liz Truss for being elected as UK's third woman PM
75.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Monday congratulated UK's Prime Minister-elect Liz Truss. "Confident that under your leadership, the India-UK Comprehensive Strategic Partnership will be further strengthened. Wish you the very best for your new role and responsibilities," PM Modi tweeted. Truss, UK's former Foreign Minister, was elected as UK's third woman PM on Monday after securing 81,326 votes.

76.title: President Murmu presents National Teachers' Award to 45 teachers
76.article_body: President Droupadi Murmu on Monday presented the National Teachers' Award to 45 teachers from across the country for their work in the education sector. The awards were presented during an event in Delhi on the occasion of Teacher's Day. President Murmu said science, research and innovation are the basis of development in today's knowledge economy.

77.title: Karnataka seer found dead at Guru Madiwaleshwar Mutt, suicide suspected
77.article_body: A seer of Karnataka's Sri Guru Madiwaleshwar Mutt was found dead inside the mutt in Belagavi district on Monday. Police suspect that he died by suicide. The seer was reportedly upset over a video in which two women were seen discussing the alleged cases of sexual assault in some mutts. His name was also mentioned in the video.

78.title: Punjab minister talks to Arshdeep's mother on phone after he gets abused, shares video
78.article_body: Punjab Sports Minister Gurmeet Singh Meet Hayer shared a video posted by AAP wherein he can be seen talking to pacer Arshdeep Singh's mother Baljit Kaur after he got abused online for dropping a catch against Pakistan. "Entire Punjab, entire nation is with...Arshdeep...When he returns, I will go with you to receive him from the airport," he told Baljit.

79.title: Pa Ranjith's best work: Rajinikanth on 'Natchathiram Nagargiradhu'
79.article_body: Director Pa Ranjith took to Twitter and shared Rajinikanth's review for his film 'Natchathiram Nagargiradhu'. He said Rajinikanth called the film his "best work in terms of direction, writing, casting, cinematography and music". Pa Ranjith said he was "extremely touched by" Rajinikanth's appreciation. 'Natchathiram Nagargiradhu' starred Kalidas Jayaram, Kalaiyarasan Harikrishnan and others.

80.title: Delhi BJP MLAs seek dismissal of AAP govt, to meet Prez tomorrow
80.article_body: BJP leader Ramvir Singh Bidhuri has said that all BJP MLAs in Delhi will meet President Droupadi Murmu tomorrow and demand the dismissal of the Arvind Kejriwal-led AAP government in the national capital. Bidhuri said they'll give a memorandum over the same to President Murmu. This comes amid a controversy over a CBI investigation into the now-scrapped Delhi excise policy.

81.title: New Data Protection Bill, IT Act to make online world more accountable: Vaishnaw
81.article_body: Electronics and Information Technology Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw on Monday said the government is coming up with a new version of the Data Protection Bill and the amendment to the IT Act 2000, known as the Digital India Act. "What we are looking at is making the online world more accountable for what is being published there," Vaishnaw said.

82.title: Man robbed of e-rickshaw at gunpoint by 4 suspects in Delhi
82.article_body: A man was robbed of his e-rickshaw at gunpoint by four suspects in north Delhi's Burfkhana Chowk on Monday. The victim, Sushil Kumar, was going to his home in Malkaganj when the incident happened, police said. The unidentified accused threatened Sushil with a country-made weapon. Notably, a case has been registered under sections 392, 397 and 34 of IPC.

83.title: Sood Charity Foundation fulfilling my dream of becoming teacher: Sonu
83.article_body: Sonu Sood said if he wasn't an actor, he would have been a teacher. He said his dream is now coming true with 'Sood Charity Foundation', which is helping many students to pursue education. Calling his mother his "favourite teacher", Sonu shared, "Since my mother was a teacher herself, there was no excuse for me to have secured less marks."

84.title: Forced population control measures can be dangerous: Jaishankar
84.article_body: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar on Sunday said that he is against forced population control measures and that a move in that direction will have very dangerous consequences, as it can create gender imbalance. "The rate of growth of the Indian population is falling. The reason is education, social awareness and prosperity," he added.

85.title: Man stabs transgender wife for singing songs in public in Bihar
85.article_body: A man stabbed his transgender wife in Bihar after she went to sing celebratory songs at other people's houses, even after his objection, reports said. The accused beat her up initially, but later stabbed her three times in her stomach using a knife. The accused had also tried to convince his wife to leave her line of work, reports said.

86.title: SC to hear Amazon's plea against CCI's suspension of Amazon-Future deal
86.article_body: The Supreme Court on Monday agreed to hear Amazon's plea against Competition Commission of India's (CCI) order to hold its approval for Amazon's 2019 deal with Future Group's Future Coupons Private Limited (FCPL). The court has sought a reply from the concerned parties and will hear the case on September 19. Amazon moved the SC after NCLAT upheld CCI's decision.

87.title: No one has put gun on makers' head: Johar on charging big amount for judging shows
87.article_body: Karan Johar, who returned to television screens as the judge of 'Jhalak Dikhhla Jaa 10', has reacted to reports of him charging a big amount for the reality show. "I don't think anyone gets what they don't deserve. No one has put a gun on their head. So whatever money I earn is for a reason," Johar said.

88.title: Can't permit this: Minister on distortion of Arshdeep's Wikipedia page
88.article_body: While addressing the distortion of Indian cricketer Arshdeep Singh's Wikipedia page, after India's loss to Pakistan on Sunday, Union Minister Rajeev Chandrasekhar said that no intermediary operating in India can permit this type of misinformation. The left-arm pacer faced trolling on social media after he dropped a catch in the dying embers of India's Asia Cup clash with Pakistan.

89.title: 12-year-old girl bitten by stray dog dies in Kerala
89.article_body: Despite receiving three doses of the anti-rabies vaccine, a 12-year-old girl, who was bitten by a stray dog, has died at Kottayam Medical College in Kerala. She was on ventilator support after being bitten by the dog several times on August 14. Kerala Health Minister Veena George had ordered the setting up of a medical board to treat the girl.

90.title: Cyber frauds pose as Army men, cheat father-son of ₹2 lakh in Pune
90.article_body: Cyber criminals allegedly posing as senior Army officers cheated a father-son duo to the tune of ₹2 lakh in the Pune district recently, police said on Monday. The accused allegedly showed interest in the victims' property and asked them to transfer money to 'establish a contact', police said. They even showed fake identity documents to gain trust, police added.

91.title: 2 steal gold worth ₹1.24 cr from jewellery store in Mumbai, held
91.article_body: Two people have been arrested for allegedly stealing gold ornaments worth ₹1.24 crore from a jewellery store in central Mumbai, police said on Monday. The accused had broken into the store between 2 pm and 5 pm on August 24 and escaped with 2.4 kg of gold ornaments, an official said. Six teams were formed to track them down.

92.title: 'Laal Singh Chaddha' to release on OTT in October: Reports
92.article_body: Aamir Khan had earlier stated that his film 'Laal Singh Chaddha' will premiere on OTT platform after six months of its theatrical release. Now, owing to its poor performance at the box office, the makers have reportedly decided to release 'Laal Singh Chaddha' on OTT on October 20. The film also starred Kareena Kapoor Khan in a pivotal role.

93.title: CM Shinde-led Sena is real Shiv Sena, it is with BJP: Amit Shah
93.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Monday said that Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde-led Shiv Sena is the real Shiv Sena and it is with the BJP. "Uddhav Thackeray betrayed the BJP after seeking votes on the names of Narendra Modi and Devendra Fadnavis. Time has come to show Thackeray his place," said Shah.

94.title: Pune minor girls, who left home due to father's drinking habit, found
94.article_body: Two girls aged 12 and 13, who went missing from Pune district's Maval tehsil, were found on the Panvel-Nanded train in Osmanabad, police said. The girls had gone to school on Saturday but did not return home. Police said the girls were fed up with their father's drinking habit and he used to beat them up.

95.title: Radhika Madan, Nimrat Kaur announce their film 'Happy Teachers' Day'
95.article_body: Radhika Madan and Nimrat Kaur on Monday announced their upcoming film, titled 'Happy Teachers' Day', which will be produced by Dinesh Vijan's Maddock Films. Director Mikhil Musale called 'Happy Teachers' Day' a very special film, saying that it came to life "after 2 years of rigorous hard work". He thanked producers for giving him the opportunity to tell this story.

96.title: Neetu, Sunny Kaushal & Shraddha Srinath to feature in Lionsgate India's film
96.article_body: Lionsgate India announced its foray into feature film production with Neetu Kapoor, Sunny Kaushal and Shraddha Srinath's upcoming untitled Hindi film. Neetu said the script of the film moves beyond "the regular mother-son story", while Sunny called the film "an ode to all the mothers, their wishes and sacrifices". Shraddha described the film's script as "sweet, warm and delightful".

97.title: Ghulam Nabi shot himself in foot by quitting Congress: Digvijaya Singh
97.article_body: Congress leader Digvijaya Singh criticised former party leader Ghulam Nabi Azad over his exit from the party last month. "Ghulam Nabi Azad, by resigning from Congress, has shot himself in the foot," Singh added. "He may find something, somewhere, but nothing can match the honour and respect that Congress accorded to him," Singh further said.

98.title: Karnakata rape-accused mutt seer sent to judicial custody till Sept 14
98.article_body: A Chitradurga district court sent Murugha mutt chief Shivamurthy Murugha Sharanaru, the primary accused in a rape case, to judicial custody till September 14. Shivamurthy's counsel moved a bail application, and the court has directed the public prosecutor to file objections to the bail. The Karnataka Police arrested the seer on September 1 for allegedly raping two minor students.

99.title: Case filed against YouTube channel over prank videos in Coimbatore
99.article_body: The Coimbatore Police filed a suo moto case against a YouTube channel named 'Kovai 360' for recording prank videos in public places, said officials on Monday. The channel, which has about 18 lakh subscribers, had been uploading prank videos involving women, elderly and others without their consent, said police. The police warned of strict action in such cases.

100.title: Gauff becomes youngest American woman to reach US Open quarters since 2009
100.article_body: US' Coco Gauff reached her maiden quarter-final at US Open after beating China's Shuai Zhang 7-5, 7-5 on Sunday. With the win, 18-year-old Gauff became the youngest American woman to reach US Open quarter-final since Melanie Oudin in 2009. Gauff will face 17th seed Caroline Garcia, who defeated Alison Riske-Amritraj 6-4, 6-1 to enter her first quarter-final in New York.

101.title: Over-speeding kills 1 person every 6 minutes in India: Govt data
101.article_body: Over-speeding kills a person every six minutes and injures one every two minutes in India. As per the NCRB data, 87,050 people were killed and 2,28,274 injured in over-speeding incidents last year. A preliminary probe into former Tata Sons Chairman Cyrus Mistry's death revealed that not "wearing seat belt, over-speeding and error of judgment" resulted in the fatal car crash.

102.title: CBI denies Sisodia's claims that officer died by suicide due to pressure to frame him
102.article_body: The CBI denied Delhi Deputy Chief Minister Manish Sisodia's claims that a CBI officer died by suicide due to pressure to frame the AAP leader in the Delhi Excise Policy 'scam' case. "We strongly refute mischievous and misleading statement by Sisodia. It's clarified that gentleman officer late Jitendra Kumar was in no way connected with the investigation of the case."

103.title: Gurugram Police head constable arrested in bribery case
103.article_body: Haryana's State Vigilance Bureau arrested a head constable of Gurugram's DLF Phase 2 Police Station red-handed while accepting a bribe of ₹2,000 in lieu of getting a compromise in a road accident case. The state vigilance bureau has registered an FIR against the suspect, Pradeep, under the anti-corruption act. The complaint was filed by Nikhil, a native of Uttar Pradesh.

104.title: Man falls while alighting from moving train in Pune, saved by RPF
104.article_body: A passenger fell into the gap between a train and platform while trying to get down from the moving train at Pune station. He'd fallen asleep and missed getting down at the station. After realising the train had started pulling out, he tried to get down and fell. However, his life was saved after RPF policemen immediately pulled him out.

105.title: Death toll due to earthquake in China's Sichuan province reaches 21
105.article_body: The death toll from the magnitude 6.8 earthquake that hit China's Sichuan province on Monday has risen to 21. Landslides triggered by the earthquake were reported in multiple parts of the province, as per state media reports. Some roads and homes near the epicentre were damaged by landslides. The provincial power grid is also said to be affected.

106.title: Sri Lanka forms committee for repatriation of refugees from India
106.article_body: Sri Lanka's government on Monday said that it has appointed a committee to facilitate the return of Sri Lankan refugees from India. Only 3,800 Sri Lankans currently residing in India are willing to come back, the government said. Lakhs of Sri Lankan Tamils had sought refuge in India during the course of the Sri Lankan civil war.

107.title: Free education to girls, 10 lakh jobs to youth: Rahul Gandhi in Gujarat
107.article_body: Ahead of Gujarat polls, Congress MP Rahul Gandhi promised free education for girl students and jobs for the unemployed. “We will open 3,000 English medium schools and will give free education to girls. BJP government had shut thousands of schools. I want to end unemployment...The focus will be to give employment to 10 lakh youth in Gujarat,” said Rahul.

108.title: Raj Kundra approached for 'Bigg Boss 16': Reports
108.article_body: Businessman Raj Kundra, husband of actress Shilpa Shetty Kundra, has been approached for 'Bigg Boss 16', as per reports. "They feel the real side and the truth needs to be shown in front of the country," a source was quoted as saying. Raj was arrested in a pornography case in July 2021 and was released in September.

109.title: Arshdeep dropping such an easy catch was a bit surprising: Rajkumar
109.article_body: Reacting to India pacer Arshdeep Singh dropping a catch against Pakistan during their Super 4 stage match at Asia Cup 2022, Virat Kohli's childhood coach Rajkumar Sharma said it was surprising to see such an easy catch dropped. Arshdeep put down a sitter while Asif Ali was batting at zero in 18th over of Pakistan's innings. Ali scored 16 (8).

110.title: Anurag Thakur calls AAP government 'bewdi sarkar'
110.article_body: Union Minister Anurag Thakur criticised AAP government and called it a "bewdi sarkar". He alleged that Delhi CM and his deputy were involved in the liquor scam with mafia. "They are encouraging the liquor mafia. AAP doesn’t have an answer to it. It is a corrupt government. This is the identity of Arvind Kejriwal-led bewdi sarkar," said Thakur.

111.title: Novaya Gazeta newspaper's media license revoked by Russian court
111.article_body: A Russian court revoked the media license of Novaya Gazeta newspaper on Monday. Russia's media watchdog Rozkomnadzor had moved court in July accusing Novaya Gazeta of not providing documents related to a change of ownership in 2006 and sought cancellation of its license. Notably, the newspaper ceased operations when Russia tightened rules for covering the conflict in Ukraine.

112.title: BJP's 'sting' video is a 'joke', I have stings as well: Delhi Dy CM Sisodia
112.article_body: Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia on Monday questioned the veracity of BJP's 'sting video' regarding his involvement in the excise policy scam and called it a joke, adding that he has such videos as well. The video reveals that 80% of the profit will go to Arvind Kejriwal, Manish Sisodia and their friend, said BJP's Sambit Patra.

113.title: Liz Truss named as UK's next Prime Minister
113.article_body: Liz Truss has been named as the leader of the Conservative Party and UK's new Prime Minister after defeating Rishi Sunak, the former finance minister. UK caretaker PM Boris Johnson will travel to Scotland to meet Queen Elizabeth on Tuesday and officially tender his resignation. Former foreign minister Truss promised to act quickly to tackle UK's cost of living crisis.

114.title: Some faulty project reports responsible for road accidents: Gadkari
114.article_body: Union Minister Nitin Gadkari on Monday attributed some of the road accidents to few faulty project reports. "Some DPRs (Detailed Project Reports) prepared by companies are worst and are responsible for road accidents," Gadkari said. Furthermore, he said, "Beginning should be made from DPR. If the companies preparing DPRs do not improve, the problem will reoccur."

115.title: Ghaziabad Police arrests gang of drug smugglers with heroin worth ₹1 cr
115.article_body: Ghaziabad Police have arrested five people, including a woman, for allegedly smuggling heroin worth approximately ₹1 crore from Jharkhand to other states, officials said Sunday. The accused often changed cars, switched off their phones and would cut off all communication until the drugs were delivered to the buyer at a given location and time, reports said.

116.title: I'd love to be Hrithik's bouncer for a day: 'Babli Bouncer' actress Tamannaah
116.article_body: Actress Tamannaah Bhatia called Hrithik Roshan and Vicky Kaushal her favourites during the trailer launch of her upcoming movie 'Babli Bouncer'. "I would love to be Hrithik's bouncer for a day. I would also love to be Vicky's bouncer," she added. The film, directed by Madhur Bhandarkar, will feature Tamannaah as a female bouncer.

117.title: The way Bishnoi handled power play, dismissed Babar was fantastic: Irfan
117.article_body: Former India cricketer Irfan Pathan has said the way India's 22-year-old spinner Ravi Bishnoi handled the power play and picked Pakistan captain Babar Azam's wicket in the fourth over was "fantastic". Irfan added, "It is not easy, the pressure on the Indian bowlers during the game against Pakistan is a lot and Bishnoi handled the pressure very well."

118.title: Police constable suspended over video of him fighting with home guard in UP
118.article_body: A police constable was suspended after a video showing him fighting with a home guard in Uttar Pradesh's Jalaun surfaced on social media. The video, shot by a passerby, shows the two fighting at a roadside while a third official tried to stop them. "The home guard has been sent back...Strict action will be taken," said Jalaun SP Ravi Kumar.

119.title: SpiceJet defaults on depositing PF amount to staff's accounts: Report
119.article_body: SpiceJet, which delayed the disbursal of salaries amongst employees for the second consecutive month, has reportedly not deposited PF amounts in staff’s accounts. The airline has also allegedly defaulted on depositing TDS with authorities. Meanwhile, a spokesperson said that while there has been a deferral on discharging of payments, there has been no default on any statutory payments.

120.title: Will provide LPG cylinder at ₹500: Rahul in poll-bound Gujarat
120.article_body: Ahead of the Gujarat polls, Congress leader Rahul Gandhi promised a loan waiver of up to ₹3 lakh to farmers and LPG cylinders at ₹500 instead of the current price of ₹1,000 if the party comes to power in the state. He also announced free electricity to farmers and up to 300 units of free power to general consumers.

121.title: Guj is one state where you've to take permission before protesting: Rahul
121.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Monday said that Gujarat has become the "centre of drugs". "All drugs are moved from Mundra port...government doesn't take any action...This is the Gujarat model," he said in Ahmedabad. "Gujarat is one state where you have to take permission before protesting, permission from those against whom protest will be done," he stated.

122.title: Kerala church stops use of coffins, opts for nature-friendly burials
122.article_body: In a break from tradition, a Catholic church has decided to stop using caskets to bury the dead. The body will instead be wrapped in a plain linen cloth and lowered into the tomb. Parish priest Father Johnson Thaundiyil said that it will speed up decomposition. "We are returning to the simple, nature-friendly burial practice," he said.

123.title: BMC to install portable clinics in Mumbai slums amid surge in viral infections
123.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has decided to set up 15 porta cabin clinics and 13 polyclinics in Mumbai's slum areas which will be operational by the end of this month. The move comes after Mumbai recorded a spike in viral infections and vector-borne diseases. The clinics will operate in two shifts from 7 am to 10 pm.

124.title: Rainfall activity likely to increase in Pune from September 8: IMD
124.article_body: The rainfall activity is likely to increase in Pune city from September 8, according to India Meteorological Department (IMD). Officials from the weather department said there'll be continuous rainfall from September 11 to September 13 and the last day of Ganpati Visarjan is likely to witness more rainfall. Reportedly, the Pune district reported 31% excess rainfall during the monsoon season.

125.title: Guys like Pant, Hooda need to learn the way Kohli runs between wickets: Gambhir
125.article_body: Ex-India opener Gautam Gambhir has said all youngsters in Team India need to learn the way Virat Kohli runs between the wickets. "Suryakumar might have more shots...but Virat is never under pressure because of the way he runs, the way he converts ones into twos," explained Gambhir. "Not every time you'll be able to hit those big shots," he added.

126.title: 24-yr-old rape survivor fails 'virginity' test in Raj, forced to pay ₹10 lakh
126.article_body: A 24-year-old bride was allegedly tortured, beaten and forced to undergo a chastity (virginity) test in Rajasthan's Bhilwara district. A penalty of ₹10 lakh was also imposed on the rape survivor's family by the khap panchayat after she failed the test. Her father-in-law, despite knowing about the incident, made her go through the humiliation, a police official said.

127.title: Police constable in Pune injured after being attacked by criminal
127.article_body: A police constable in Pune was injured after Akash alias Bhavdya Bharat Kudale, a criminal, attacked a team of police officers from Pimpri-Chinchwad which was there to arrest him. Officials said that the injured police constable, identified as Amol Gulab Mane, is currently undergoing medical treatment in a private hospital. Mane was attacked when he was questioning the accused.

128.title: Parts of Somalia to face famine in October and December: UN
128.article_body: The United Nations has issued a warning that parts of Somalia will face a famine between October and December amid rising global food prices and worsening drought. According to experts, the Horn of Africa might face a failed rainy season for a fifth consecutive time. In 2011, Somalia faced more than quarter of a million deaths due to a famine.

129.title: It was a costly miss but it happens: Jaffer on Arshdeep dropping Asif's catch
129.article_body: Former India cricketer Wasim Jaffer has said that Arshdeep Singh's catch drop can't be blamed for India's defeat against Pakistan in their Asia Cup Super 4 stage match. "There's no doubt that it was a costly miss...but it happens in cricket at times...you can't just blame a [dropped] catch," he stated. Arshdeep dropped Asif Ali's catch in the 18th over.

130.title: 150 mobile tanks for Ganpati immersion deployed across Pune
130.article_body: The Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) deployed 150 mobile tanks for Ganpati immersion across the city on Sunday. Dr Ketaki Ghadge, Assistant Health Officer, PMC's solid waste management department, said, "Apart from that, 303 permanent tanks are also constructed in various parts of the city, and 216 idol donation spots [were] set up." Some residents also immersed the idols in rivers.

131.title: Around 10,000 sanitation workers to work for Ganesh immersion in Hyderabad
131.article_body: Around 10,000 sanitation workers, 280 cranes along with 100 swimmers with boats will be employed at all the water bodies in Hyderabad on September 9 for Ganesh idol immersion, GHMC Mayor Gadwal Vijayalaxmi said. As per the Mayor's directions, at every 3 to 4 kilometres there should be 25 sanitation employees, and around 14 volunteers to operate cranes.

132.title: Manmohan Singh selected me as professor at IIT Delhi in 1970: Swamy
132.article_body: BJP member Subramanian Swamy recalled his first meeting with former PM Manmohan Singh. "[In] 1970, I was selected by Manmohan as an Economics Professor at IIT Delhi. He chaired the 10-member selection committee and unanimously got me chosen against all Communists screaming away," Swamy tweeted. He added, "In 1990...I got him selected as [an] Economic Adviser to ex-PM Chandra Shekhar."

133.title: 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' is no 'Mann Ki Baat', it's about concern for people: Cong
133.article_body: Congress leader Jairam Ramesh on Monday said 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' is not a 'Mann Ki Baat' in any manner. "It's about the concern for people. Its objective is to ensure that the concerns and demands expressed by the people reach Delhi," Ramesh added. "It (yatra) is not about long speeches, preaching, dramatics [or] teleprompter, we're going to listen," he stated.

134.title: Boy steals women's undergarments in Gwalior; caught on CCTV camera
134.article_body: A ladies' undergarments thief is running amok in Madhya Pradesh's Gwalior, a report said. Police have registered a case after a businessman reported that a boy entered his house in the middle of the night and stole his wife's undergarments. He was also caught on CCTV camera. Meanwhile, police have identified the accused as a local living in the area.

135.title: Govt committed to privatisation, bank reforms amid challenges: FM
135.article_body: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said India is the fastest growing economy despite global headwinds. During her address at an event, Sitharaman said the government is committed to privatising PSU enterprises. She emphasised that India will have to reset a lot of things to be a developed nation by 2047, calling digitisation, education and infrastructure the biggest tools.

136.title: I don't think any film can tank because of boycott trend: Goldie on 'Liger'
136.article_body: Filmmaker Goldie Behl, when asked if Vijay Deverakonda's 'Liger' failed because of the boycott trend, said, "No, I don't think so any film can tank at...box office because of a trend of boycotting...film." He added no trend can stop a good film from succeeding. He further said if a film connects with the audience, nothing can stop it from succeeding.

137.title: At times I feel bad: Bhavana on actors making fun of Chunky Panday
137.article_body: Bhavana Pandey, wife of actor Chunky Panday, said on 'Fabulous Lives of Bollywood Wives' that she sometimes feels bad when her husband's co-actors make fun of him. "Sometimes I'm like, 'Why do you allow them?'," she added. Chunky, however, said that he feels he should always be the topic of discussion whether good or bad.

138.title: KRK seems to be victim of conspiracy: Shatrughan Sinha on his arrest
138.article_body: Actor-turned-politician Shatrughan Sinha has defended Kamaal R Khan after the latter was arrested by Malad Police last week over the tweets he posted in 2020. "He seems to be a victim of a conspiracy of circumstances...wish...that KRK gets justice which he deserves soon," Shatrughan tweeted. KRK was arrested again on Monday for demanding sexual favours in a 2019 case.

139.title: BJP releases 'sting video' to claim AAP leaders took money under excise policy
139.article_body: BJP has released 'sting videos' to claim Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal and deputy CM Manish Sisodia took "commissions" worth "hundreds of crores" to benefit private players under the now scrapped excise policy. BJP said, "Why was the older policy, and then new one, withdrawn; why were blacklisted companies given contracts and why was the commission increased from 2% to 12%?"

140.title: Uddhav ditched BJP by breaking alliance in 2014 for seeking 2 seats: Shah
140.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Monday said Shiv Sena President Uddhav Thackeray ditched BJP by breaking their alliance in 2014 for seeking two seats. "Uddhav Thackeray betrayed BJP after seeking votes on the names of (Prime Minister) Narendra Modi and (Maharashtra Deputy CM) Devendra Fadnavis," Shah said. "Those who ditch somebody in politics never become successful," he added.

141.title: J'khand govt obstructing probe into 2 minor girls' deaths: NCPCR chief
141.article_body: NCPCR chief Priyank Kanoongo, who reached Jharkhand's Dumka to probe deaths of two minor girls, said the state government is "very uncooperative" and is "obstructing the investigation". "A team of NCPCR wanted to meet the family of the girl who was hanged after rape…After coming to the village, however, her parents could not be found," tweeted Kanoongo.

142.title: CBI officer died by suicide as he was pressured to frame me in fake case: Manish Sisodia
142.article_body: Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia claimed a CBI officer died by suicide as he was pressured to frame him in a "fake case". "He wasn't permitting it...Pressure was being mounted to make a false case legally sound," Sisodia added. Sisodia's remarks come after BJP claimed he took "commissions" worth "crores" to benefit private players under the now scrapped excise policy.

143.title: RERA warns of action against agents charging arbitrary brokerage in G'gram
143.article_body: The Haryana Real Estate Regulatory Authority (HRERA) warned real estate agents of action against charging arbitrary brokerage from property buyers and sellers. The authority issued a warning to 1,840 agents in Gurugram. "We will revoke, blacklist and debar agents or brokers who charge exorbitant commissions in contravention of the rule," HRERA Gurugram Chairman KK Khandelwal said.

144.title: Former Malaysian PM Najib jailed for corruption seeks royal pardon
144.article_body: Former Malaysian PM Najib Razak, who was sentenced to 12 years of imprisonment for corruption, has applied for a royal pardon, the country's Parliament Speaker said on Monday. In August, Malaysia's top court upheld Najib's conviction in state fund 1Malaysia Development Berhad corruption case. Najib will lose his parliamentary seat only if the petition is rejected, the Parliament Speaker added.

145.title: BJP leader Kirpal Singh shot dead in Rajasthan, police suspect gang rivalry
145.article_body: BJP leader Kirpal Singh, a close aide of BJP MP from Rajasthan's Bharatpur Ranjeeta Koli, was shot dead in the city on Sunday. The assailants opened fire at Kirpal while he was going home from circuit house in his car. Police suspect the killing to be a result of gang rivalry. "The accused are being identified," a police official said.

146.title: I feel guilty I'm unable to spend time with newborn son: Dheeraj Dhoopar
146.article_body: Actor Dheeraj Dhooper has said he feels guilty as he is unable to spend "enough time" with his newborn son. Speaking about his busy schedule, Dheeraj said he wished he had 50 hours in a day. "The 24 hours I have, I'm just going all out...doing everything that's needed," he added. The actor is part of 'Jhalak Dikhhla Jaa 10'.

147.title: Had Nawaz not scored, Pak wouldn’t have reached till the end: Sehwag
147.article_body: Former India opener Virender Sehwag has said all-rounder Muhammad Nawaz played the most impactful innings among the Pakistan batters while chasing India's 182-run target. "Had Nawaz not scored 40 off 22 deliveries, Pakistan would not have reached till the end...helped take the pressure off Rizwan," stated Sehwag. Nawaz and Rizwan added 73 runs off 41 balls.

148.title: Researchers working on app to detect COVID-19 using users' voice samples
148.article_body: Researchers at Netherland's Maastricht University on Monday said they're working on a smartphone app that can accurately detect COVID-19 infection in people's voices with the help of artificial intelligence. They claimed that the app is more accurate than several antigen tests. The app's results have a turnaround time of less than a minute, a researcher said.

149.title: Video shows policeman clearing waterlogged B'luru street with stick
149.article_body: The Bengaluru Traffic Police on Monday shared a video showing a policeman clearing the waterlogged Spice Garden. Several parts of the city were severely waterlogged and traffic was affected due to heavy rains. Bengaluru recorded 131.6 mm of rainfall in the last 24 hours, the India Meteorological Department (IMD) said.

150.title: Centre abolishes 3,000 CISF posts at airports, Congress criticises move
150.article_body: The Centre has decided to abolish 3,049 CISF aviation security posts, which will be replaced by 1,924 private security personnel at various airports. The Congress criticised the move saying the government is playing with the security of the airports. "Actions in the name of cutting down on security expenses cannot be tolerated," said the party.

151.title: BJP trying to create civil war-like situation in country: Soren
151.article_body: Jharkhand CM Hemant Soren on Monday said that the BJP is trying to create a "civil war-like situation in the country by fuelling riots to win elections". Soren made the statement during a state Assembly session convened to hold trust motion. "The BJP has been indulging in horse-trading of legislators," he added.

152.title: Sanjay Raut’s custody extended till September 19 in land scam case
152.article_body: A special PMLA court extended Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut’s judicial custody till September 19. He was arrested by the ED on August 1 after over six hours of questioning in the ₹1,034-crore Patra Chawl land scam case. Earlier in August, Raut’s wife was also questioned by the probe agency in connection to the same case.

153.title: 6 booked for torturing, assaulting doctor over dowry in Gurugram
153.article_body: Gurugram Police have registered an FIR against a man and his five family members, for allegedly subjecting his wife, a doctor of the Haryana government, to cruelty and mental and physical torture for dowry. Police said that the doctor had also alleged that she was subjected to unnatural sex by her husband.

154.title: 19-year-old man arrested for raping class 8 student in Gurugram
154.article_body: A 19-year-old man was arrested by the Gurugram Police for allegedly raping a class 8 student. The accused, Shiva, allegedly laced a drink with some sedatives and then raped the 14-year-old girl at an isolated place, police said. Notably, Shiva works with a Manesar-based private company and has been currently sent to 14-day judicial custody, police added.

155.title: Appears to be handiwork of another IT cell: Panag on Arshdeep being trolled
155.article_body: Actress Gul Panag defended pacer Arshdeep Singh on Twitter after the latter was trolled for dropping a catch during India versus Pakistan Asia Cup 2022 Super 4 stage match. "Truly tragic the way Arshdeep has been trolled...it appears to be the handiwork of another IT cell," Panag tweeted. Arshdeep had dropped Asif Ali's catch in the 18th over.

156.title: SC notice to ECI over plea against political parties using religion symbols
156.article_body: Supreme Court on Monday issued a notice to the Election Commission of India (ECI) following a plea to cancel symbols and names allotted to political parties which use religion or religious connotations. The plea states using religion to lure voters is strictly prohibited under section 123 of The Representation of People Act, 1951 citing the secular values of the Constitution.

157.title: Gurugram district reports 1st death related to lumpy skin disease
157.article_body: Gurugram district on Friday reported its first death related to the lumpy skin disease. The Deputy Director of Haryana's Animal Husbandry and Dairying Department, Dr Punita Gahlawat said that a one-year-old Heifer cow has died in Pataudi's Noorgarh village. As per the department, 94 cases of the disease have been detected in 24 areas in the district.

158.title: BJP attempting to destabilise democratically elected state govts: J'khand CM
158.article_body: BJP is attempting to destabilise democratically elected state governments in non-BJP ruled states, Jharkhand CM Hemant Soren said on Monday in state Assembly. "Assam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma indulged in purchase of Jharkhand MLAs," Soren added during the confidence motion. "They want to create an atmosphere of civil war and want to fan riots to win polls," he stated.

159.title: Bengaluru sees wettest September day since 2014
159.article_body: Bengaluru on Monday saw the wettest September day since 2014, with a rainfall of 131.6 mm in the last 24 hours. Several parts of the city were heavily waterlogged and traffic was affected due to the downpour. Traffic police asked people to avoid Outer Ring Road, Sarjapura Road, Doddakannelli Road and Bellandur Road.

160.title: 8 killed as 5.3 magnitude earthquake hits Afghanistan
160.article_body: At least eight people were killed after an earthquake hit northeastern Afghanistan on Monday, the state news agency reported. According to the United States Geological Survey (USGS), the 5.3 magnitude earthquake struck near the city of Jalalabad. Afghanistan was hit by a strong earthquake in June in which more than 1,000 people were killed.

161.title: Israeli Prez visits Germany to commemorate Munich Olympics massacre
161.article_body: Israeli President Isaac Herzog has arrived in Germany for a three-day visit. He will join a commemoration ceremony for the 50th anniversary of the massacre at the 1972 Munich Olympics. Relatives of the victims, who had initially declined, will attend the commemoration. On Tuesday, Herzog will give a speech in the German Parliament and will visit a former concentration camp.

162.title: Thieves drill hole in TN shop's wall, pass out after drinking liquor they came to steal
162.article_body: Two men were arrested in Tamil Nadu after they allegedly drilled a hole in the wall of a liquor shop and ended up passing out in the shop after drinking the same liquor they had come to steal. The police also recorded a video of how they came out of the same hole they had drilled for the theft.

163.title: Kyrgios played like Nadal, Djokovic: Medvedev on US Open 4th round loss
163.article_body: After defending champion Daniil Medvedev crashed out of US Open 2022 following his loss against 23rd seed Nick Kyrgios, Medvedev said that the Australian played to the level of Rafael Nadal and Novak Djokovic in the fourth round. "It was a high-level match...He [Kyrgios] is tough to play," he added. Kyrgios defeated world number one Medvedev 7-6(13-11), 3-6, 6-3, 6-2.

164.title: Porsche IPO is a 'key element' of our strategy: Volkswagen CFO
164.article_body: Volkswagen CFO Arno Antlitz has said the planned listing of Porsche is a "key element" of the firm's strategy. Its management and supervisory boards are to discuss the possibility of an IPO at September end or early October amid troubled global markets. Antlitz added the possible IPO proceeds would give the firm more flexibility to further accelerate its transformation.

165.title: Hyderabad Madrassa teacher sent to judicial custody for sodomising minor
165.article_body: A Hyderabad Madrassa teacher has been sent to judicial custody after he was arrested for allegedly sodomising a 14-year-old minor in the Santosh Nagar area. "A case was filed under the relevant sections of POCSO after the victim’s family filed a complaint against the teacher...The accused was arrested and has been sent to judicial remand,” police said.

166.title: Differently-abled girl kills self in UP hostel, no suicide note recovered
166.article_body: A 26-year-old differently-abled female student allegedly died by suicide in her hostel room on the campus of Dr Shakuntala Misra National Rehabilitation University (DSMNRU) here in Lucknow. Reports said that she was rushed to the Lok Bandhu hospital, where she was declared dead. Police said no suicide note has been recovered.

167.title: Foreign policies no longer impacted by vote bank politics: Jaishankar
167.article_body: Talking about India-Israel ties, External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar said that those days are gone when vote bank politics impacted foreign policies. “We had some political reasons owing to which we did not further our ties with Israel. We restricted ourselves. PM Modi was the first PM in the history of India to have visited Israel,” said Jaishankar.

168.title: S Korea raises typhoon alert to 'very strong', many flights cancelled
168.article_body: South Korea has raised the typhoon alert as the south of the country witnessed heavy rains and strong winds. Typhoon Hinnamnor led to flight cancellation, school closure and suspension of business operations. Warnings have been issued in southern cities of Busan, Gwangju, Daegu, Ulsan and Jeju. Hinnamnor has been categorised as a "very strong" typhoon.

169.title: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar likely to meet opposition leaders in Delhi today
169.article_body: According to reports, Bihar CM Nitish Kumar is expected to meet prominent leaders in the national capital today to talk about strengthening opposition unity for the 2024 Lok Sabha elections. “If all (opposition) parties fight together, the BJP will be packed...We will work on that. BJP has disrupted the social and communal harmony,” Kumar said during JD(U)'s executive meet.

170.title: Improvement in per capita income would have been satisfactory: Mayawati
170.article_body: As India overtook the UK to become the world’s fifth largest economy, former UP CM Mayawati said that it would have been satisfactory if figures showed improvement in per capita income. “Britain's per capita income is about 20 times more than India…If India achieves it, it will help in removing country’s problems like poverty and unemployment," said Mayawati.

171.title: Home Minister Amit Shah meets Rohit Shetty in Mumbai, shares pic
171.article_body: Home Minister Amit Shah, who is on a two-day visit to Mumbai, met filmmaker Rohit Shetty. Taking to Twitter, Shah shared a picture from the meeting and wrote, "Met noted director Rohit Shetty, today in Mumbai." 'Singham' director Rohit's upcoming directorial 'Indian Police Force' features actor Sidharth Malhotra and actress Shilpa Shetty.

172.title: Rajinikanth, Haasan to attend pre-release event of 'Ponniyin...'
172.article_body: Actors Rajinikanth and Kamal Haasan will be attending the music and trailer launch event of Mani Ratnam's 'Ponniyin Selvan: Part One', Lyca Productions tweeted. "It can't get any bigger or better than this," the tweet further read. The event will take place on September 6. Vikram, Karthi and Aishwarya Rai Bachchan will feature in the film.

173.title: We were expecting short balls: Nawaz on scoring 42(20) vs India
173.article_body: Pakistan all-rounder Muhammad Nawaz has said they were prepared for India's short-ball attack in their Asia Cup match on Sunday. "In the first match they got wickets from short balls, so we were expecting them to go that route again. We practiced with this thought in mind," he added. Nawaz smashed 42(20) to help Pakistan chase down India's 181-run total.

174.title: WhatsApp may soon allow users to text themselves across devices: Report
174.article_body: WhatsApp is working on a feature to allow users to message themselves from multiple devices linked to their accounts, WABetaInfo reported. The feature was spotted in the desktop beta. Once the feature is available to users, they will see a contact labeled 'You' in their chat list and they will be able to send messages to it via linked devices.

175.title: S Korean govt's YouTube channel hacked, streams Elon Musk's interview: Report
