175.article_body: The South Korean government's YouTube channel was hacked on Saturday to stream the video of an interview with Tesla CEO Elon Musk, according to reports. The channel's name was changed to 'SpaceX Invest' and it showed a live broadcast on cryptocurrency. A government official said security measures were undertaken and the channel was restored about four hours after the hack.

176.title: UP CM Yogi orders joint probe into fire incident at Lucknow hotel
176.article_body: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath on Monday ordered a joint probe by the Divisional Commissioner and Police Commissioner of Lucknow into the fire incident at Hotel Levana in Hazratganj area. Two people were killed in the fire that broke out on Monday morning. Relief teams had to break the windows of the hotel with iron rods to rescue trapped people.

177.title: 30-yr-old woman killed by tanker while avoiding pothole in Thane
177.article_body: A 30-year-old woman was crushed to death by a tanker after she fell off her two-wheeler while avoiding a pothole in Maharashtra's Thane district on Sunday, police said. The victim, identified as Kavita Mhatre, was riding her scooter to work when she tried to avoid a pothole on the flyover and fell, an official from the city police said.

178.title: Suicide bomber blows himself up outside Russian embassy in Kabul, several feared dead
178.article_body: A suicide bomber blew himself up outside the the Russian embassy in Afghanistan's Kabul. Several people are feared to be dead in the attack. The Russian Foreign Ministry confirmed that at least two embassy staffers have been killed. As per the police, the suicide bomber was shot dead by the guards, but he still succeeded in detonating the device.

179.title: NIA court rejects Gautam Navlakha's bail plea in Elgar Parishad case
179.article_body: A special NIA court on Monday rejected the bail plea of activist Gautam Navlakha, who was arrested in connection with the Elgar Parishad case. The case pertains to alleged inflammatory speeches made at the Pune event in 2017. After being placed under house arrest initially, he was later sent to judicial custody at Navi Mumbai's Taloja prison.

180.title: Hyd college staffer injured in student leader's suicide bid, dies
180.article_body: Hyderabad's Narayana college's administration officer succumbed to burn injuries after a student leader's suicide bid at the college started a fire. The incident took place in August and a few people, including the student and the deceased, were injured. The student leader had doused himself in petrol and threatened to set himself on fire over a student's transfer certificate's non-issuance.

181.title: Govt summons Wikipedia execs after Arshdeep's page edited to show links with Khalistan
181.article_body: The government has summoned Wikipedia executives after India pacer Arshdeep Singh's page was edited to show links with Khalistan after he dropped a catch against Pakistan. As per preliminary reports, the edits were made by accounts linked to Pakistan. The government panel will reportedly question Wikipedia executives on checks and balances in place on their platform to avoid such edits.

182.title: Extremely ordinary bowling performance, no idea what Chahal was doing: Sodhi
182.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Reetinder Sodhi has criticised Team India's bowling against Pakistan, stating that it was an "extremely ordinary performance". "I have no idea what Chahal was doing in the 15th over...Hardik was probably thinking that he was bowling in the last game where the wicket was spongy. Bhuvneshwar completely forgot to bowl the yorkers in the 19th over," added Sodhi.

183.title: Nitish Kumar meets Lalu Yadav in Patna before leaving for Delhi
183.article_body: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar met RJD chief Lalu Prasad Yadav at the latter's residence in Patna today before leaving for Delhi. Kumar met Yadav in the presence of Deputy CM Tejashwi Yadav and Rabri Devi. Nitish Kumar will reportedly meet the leaders of Opposition parties including Congress leader Rahul Gandhi during his two days stay in Delhi.

184.title: 52% cases of crime against women in 2022 considered false in Raj: Data
184.article_body: As per police data till July 2022, only 48% of the total cases of crimes against women in Rajasthan included a final report (FR), while 52% of the total cases were considered false. The cases in which FR was imposed also include those in which victims didn't give statements over social pressure or lack of witnesses during police investigation.

185.title: Supreme Court issues notice to Centre to control population explosion
185.article_body: Supreme Court on Monday issued notice to Centre on a PIL seeking directions to frame effective rules, regulations and guidelines to control population explosion. The apex court has tagged the plea along with similar or pending PILs. The new PIL seeks to make Two-Child Law as criteria for government jobs, aids and subsidies and rights to vote, contest and property.

186.title: Don't humiliate anyone on these mistakes: Hafeez on Arshdeep getting abused for catch drop
186.article_body: Former Pakistan all-rounder Mohammad Hafeez took to Twitter to defend Team India fast bowler Arshdeep Singh after he was abused on social media for dropping a catch against Pakistan on Sunday. "My request to all Indian team fans. In sports we make mistakes as we [are] human. Please don’t humiliate anyone on these mistakes," he wrote.

187.title: Central Bank files ₹1,047 cr insolvency case against Future's Biyanis: Report
187.article_body: Central Bank of India has filed a personal insolvency case against debt-laden Future Group's promoters, The Economic Times reported. The bank is claiming a total of ₹1,047 crore from the company's Founder Kishore Biyani, his brother Vijay Biyani and cousin Sunil Biyani, the report said. Future Group is facing bankruptcy proceedings after its deal with Reliance Industries fell through.

188.title: Delhi initiates pilot project of Student Advisory Board in govt schools
188.article_body: Delhi Directorate of Education (DoE) has initiated a pilot project inducting school students into a Student Advisory Board (SAB) in the national capital's government schools. SAB will comprise students from classes 7, 8, 9 and 11 and they will be elected through intra-section elections. The parameters include over 90% attendance, timely submissions of work and participation in group activities.

189.title: India's school education among world's largest education systems: Prez
189.article_body: President Droupadi Murmu on Monday said India's school education is among the world's largest education systems. "Talent development in science, literature and social sciences can be more effective if taught in the mother tongue," she added while addressing the gathering at National Teachers Awards ceremony. She also recalled the contribution of her school teachers.

190.title: 3 men, including 'politician's son' strip, flash; assault man in Mumbai
190.article_body: A family, including a seven-year-old girl, were subjected to foul language and the child's father was manhandled when they objected to three men urinating and holding their private parts in Mumbai. One of the accused asked a constable who arrived on the scene to speak to his 'politician mother' and escaped, reports said. Another accused also escaped.

191.title: Bengaluru drinking water supply to be hit for 2 days as BWSSB pumping station submerged
191.article_body: Drinking water supply from the river Cauvery to Bengaluru will be affected for two days as the Bangalore Water Supply and Sewerage Board (BWSSB) pumping station in Karnataka's Mandya district is submerged due to heavy rains, reports said. Meanwhile, heavy rains have caused traffic disruptions in the city. Chaos was also witnessed at the Bengaluru airport.

192.title: 6.8 magnitude earthquake hits China, 7 die
192.article_body: At least seven people have died after an earthquake of magnitude 6.8 hit Luding county in China's Sichuan province on Monday, state media reported. Authorities have reported that the earthquake caused landslides, damaged houses and caused power disruptions, state broadcaster CCTV said. Moreover, the country's Ministry of Emergency Management said that one landslide has blocked a rural highway.

193.title: Ghaziabad man, wife argue over his affair, daughter kills him with stone
193.article_body: A 40-year-old jeweller was found dead in his car on Sunday in Ghaziabad. His wife and daughter have been arrested for his murder. The accused said that deceased man had an extramarital affair. The wife and the man got into an argument on the intervening night of Saturday and Sunday, during which, the daughter hit the man with a stone.

194.title: Crab shells to make biodegradable electrolyte for batteries in US
194.article_body: University of Maryland's Center for Materials Innovation scientists have developed a new zinc battery with an electrolyte extracted from crab shells. The electrolyte is made from chitosan, a chemical derivative of chitin found in crab shells. About two-thirds of the battery could be broken down by microbes. The battery reportedly has an energy efficiency of 99.7% after 1,000 battery cycles.

195.title: Barring a few, condition of govt schools across country is pathetic: Kejriwal
195.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Monday said that unless we start providing good education in government schools, the dream of becoming a developed country will always remain distant. "We know that the condition of government schools all across the country, barring a few, is pathetic," Kejriwal added while addressing an event in Chennai.

196.title: Cloudflare blocks hate site Kiwi Farms over ‘threat to human life’
196.article_body: Cloudflare has blocked harassment campaign site Kiwi Farms citing an escalation in targeted threats on it. Cloudflare came under pressure to drop Kiwi Farms as a customer after the forum forced a transgender Twitch streamer into hiding. "We believe there is an unprecedented emergency and immediate threat to human life unlike we have previously seen from Kiwi Farms," Cloudflare said.

197.title: Over 17,800 Ganesh idols immersed in Mumbai on day 5 of Ganeshotsav
197.article_body: Over 17,800 Ganesh idols were immersed at Mumbai's beaches and artificial ponds on the fifth day of Ganeshotsav (Sunday), a Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) official said. As many as 17,536 household idols, 23 Hartalika and 261 sarvajanik (community) idols were immersed till 9 pm yesterday, the official added. Out of these, over 6,900 idols were immersed in artificial ponds.

198.title: I miss Balwinder Singh Sandhu & his contribution to 83: Ranveer Singh
198.article_body: Actor Ranveer Singh has said that he "really misses" former cricketer Balwinder Singh Sandhu and his contribution to his film '83'. He further added, "He's the heart of '83'!" Ranveer won the Best Actor award for '83' at the Filmfare Awards. The actor will next be seen in Karan Johar's 'Rocky Aur Rani Ki Prem Kahani'.

199.title: Seat belt mandatory in rear seats but enforcement tough: Delhi traffic officials
199.article_body: Delhi traffic officials have stated that wearing seat belts for the rear seat passengers is mandatory, however, it is tough to enforce the law since traffic personnel can't check every car for violations. As per data shared by the department, over 1,900 people died in Delhi last year in road accidents involving the negligence of the driver or occupants.

200.title: Boats deployed to rescue residents from flooded Bengaluru areas, chaos at airport
200.article_body: Traffic was disrupted in several parts of Bengaluru due to heavy rains. According to reports, inflatable boats had to be brought out in some areas to rescue citizens. Chaos was also witnessed at the Bengaluru airport. A Twitter user shared a video from the airport and said, "I feel like crying seeing the state of infra in India."

201.title: Chahal is senior but Bishnoi bowled the tough overs: Gambhir
201.article_body: Ex-India opener Gautam Gambhir has praised spinner Ravi Bishnoi for his performance against Pakistan. "I think Bishnoi did a fabulous job...Bowling the fourth over and getting Babar out, bowling the 18th over...[Yuzvendra] Chahal is the senior, [but] he has actually bowled the easier overs as compared to someone like Bishnoi," stated Gambhir. Bishnoi registered figures of 1/26 in the match.

202.title: 2 women beaten to death with sticks over witchcraft suspicion in J'khand
202.article_body: Bodies of two women, who were allegedly killed over suspicion of practising witchcraft near Jharkhand's Ranchi, have been found. Reports said another woman is missing and search is on to find her. Police said the deceased appeared to have been hit with sticks and dumped in hilly area. "Police team was rushed to spot after we received information," police added.

203.title: UP truck driver's 2 wives die by suicide over financial constraints
203.article_body: Two wives of a truck driver allegedly died by suicide after consuming poison over financial constraints in Uttar Pradesh's Muzaffarnagar on Sunday, police said. The truck of the deceased's husband had been apparently impounded by traffic department officials four months ago due to the non-completion of documents. The husband claimed that the truck was his only source of income.

204.title: Delhi man kills mother, then dies by suicide, 77-page suicide note found: Police
204.article_body: A 25-year-old man died by suicide on Sunday, days after killing his mother in Rohini, Delhi Police said. According to police, the man killed his mother two or three days ago and then killed himself with a knife on Sunday. Police said they also found a suicide note of about 77 pages.

205.title: SEIAA approves AIIMS revamp plan, 47% of trees at site to be removed
205.article_body: Delhi's State Environment Impact Assessment Authority (SEIAA) has given approval for the redevelopment of the All India Institute of Medical Sciences (AIIMS). The project will lead to the removal of 47% of trees at the site, noted SEIAA. Of the around 5,575 trees present at the AIIMS project site, 1,910 trees are to be transplanted and 731 will be cut.

206.title: CCTV footage shows Cyrus Mistry's car minutes before accident near Mumbai
206.article_body: CCTV footage has surfaced on social media showing former Tata Sons Chairman Cyrus Mistry’s car, minutes before the accident near Mumbai. According to the preliminary probe, the car was overspeeding and the driver lost control while trying to overtake a vehicle from the left side. Mistry, who was seated in the back seat, was not wearing a seatbelt.

207.title: Apple to unveil new AirPods Pro 2 with H1 chip on Sept 7: Report
207.article_body: Apple is set to unveil the second generation of the AirPods Pro at its 'Far Out' event on September 7, Bloomberg's Mark Gurman has reported. He said, "The new AirPods Pro will update a model that first went on sale in...October 2019." The new AirPods will reportedly include Apple's next-generation H1 processor for improved audio quality and battery life.

208.title: Hackers steal actor Bill Murray's crypto after $185,000 charity auction
208.article_body: Hackers have stolen crypto worth more than $185,000 raised by actor and comedian Bill Murray as part of a charity auction. Murray had auctioned off a "Beer with Bill Murray" NFT on Wednesday, which was won by Coinbase user Brant Boersma for 119.2 ETH. Following the incident, the runner-up, Coinbase user Mishap72, donated 120 ETH to reimburse the charity.

209.title: Delhi reports 6th monkeypox case as 22-year-old woman tests positive
209.article_body: Sixth case of monkeypox disease has been detected in a 22-year-old woman of African origin in Delhi. Reports said that the woman was admitted to the isolation facility of Delhi government-run Lok Nayak Hospital (LNH) on August 31. She had arrived in India in January this year. She visited the hospital with complaints of fever, sore throat and skin lesions.

210.title: US woman calls 911 using smartwatch after she's stuck upside down in gym at 3 am
210.article_body: A woman in Ohio had to call 911 using her smartwatch after she got herself stuck upside down while using an inversion table at the gym around 3 am. The woman was recording herself doing the exercise on the inversion table, which suspends the body upside down to help relieve back pain. Her videos garnered millions of views on TikTok.

211.title: Jharkhand Assembly passes motion of confidence tabled by CM Hemant Soren
211.article_body: Jharkhand Assembly on Monday passed the motion of confidence moved by CM Hemant Soren. Forty-eight MLAs voted in favour and none voted against it as Opposition MLAs walked out of the Assembly. Soren was reportedly facing uncertainty over his continuance as Chief Minister following a petition by the BJP seeking his disqualification as an MLA in an office-of-profit case.

212.title: Vikram Vedha trailer to be shown before Brahmastra in cinemas: Report
212.article_body: The trailer of 'Vikram Vedha' will reportedly be shown before the shows of 'Brahmastra' in cinemas. A source stated, "The theatres have been asked to play the trailer just before 'Brahmastra' starts. The exhibitors have agreed to this request as they know that 'Vikram Vedha' looks like a potential hit." 'Vikram Vedha' will feature Hrithik Roshan and Saif Ali Khan.

213.title: Shah, Shinde & Fadnavis offer prayers to Mumbai's Lalbaugcha Raja
213.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah, Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde and the state Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis offered prayers to Lalbaugcha Raja in Mumbai on Monday. Shinde shared pictures and a video of the event which show Shah offering floral tribute. Other senior BJP leaders like Vinod Tawde and Chandrashekhar Bawankule were also present. "Feeling blessed!" Fadnavis tweeted.

214.title: He always made time if you wanted to meet: Snapdeal CEO on Mistry
214.article_body: Snapdeal CEO Kunal Bahl took to Twitter to mourn the death of former Tata Sons Chairman Cyrus Mistry. "[He] always made time if you wanted to meet him and forever curious," Bahl said. OYO Rooms CEO Ritesh Agarwal said Mistry's demise is "an irreplaceable loss for the country". "His contributions to the nation's growth will always be remembered," Agarwal added.

215.title: Gurugram civic body to demarcate parking in major markets, govt buildings
215.article_body: In a move to curb haphazard parking in the city, the Municipal Corporation of Gurugram (MCG) is likely to demarcate dedicated parking areas by the next month, officials said. The demarcation will be done across all major markets, government buildings, community centres, parks, etc. The civic body will apply thermoplastic paint on roads for demarcating dedicated parking slots, officials added.

216.title: Teen stabs 40-year-old man to death after fight over momos in Delhi
216.article_body: A 40-year-old man was stabbed to death by a teenager following a fight over a plate of momos in Delhi's Ranhola on Saturday. The incident occurred when the victim's hand accidentally touched the teenager's hand and his plate fell. The accused, who was allegedly drunk, pulled out a knife and stabbed the victim on his neck before fleeing, police said.

217.title: RBI telling fintechs 'Don't do digital lending': Grover on RBI's new rules
217.article_body: BharatPe Co-founder Ashneer Grover has criticised the RBI's new digital lending guidelines, calling it the worst "regulatory innovation in the world". Grover wrote in a tweet, "RBI is telling fintechs 'Bhai mat karo digital lending shending'." The new rules bar lenders from storing borrowers' data and require direct transfer of disbursements and repayments between borrowers and regulated entities.

218.title: Three more matches, then we never have to play tennis: Kyrgios
218.article_body: After reaching the US Open quarterfinals for the first time, Australian tennis player Nick Kyrgios said, "I'm just glad I'm finally able to show New York my talent...I haven't had too many great trips here." He jokingly added, "Three more matches potentially...then we never have to play tennis again." Kyrgios defeated world number one Daniil Medvedev in his round-of-16 match.

219.title: You can love me, hate me; but don’t be indifferent to me: Karan Johar
219.article_body: Filmmaker Karan Johar has said that he does not fear failure, however, he fears indifference now. "Over the years, [the fear of being trolled] started diminishing. I am afraid that I may do something and no one would care about it," he further added. Karan's next directorial 'Rocky Aur Rani Ki Prem Kahani' features Ranveer Singh and Alia Bhatt.

220.title: Protests held at 3 railway stations in WB seeking increased train frequency
220.article_body: Protests were staged at three railway stations in West Bengal's Hooghly district on Monday demanding increase in train service frequency to accommodate passenger rush. The protests were held at Khanyan, Palandu and Pandua stations with stones reportedly being hurled at a train in Khanyan. Railway officials stated services have been curtailed over ongoing work on a stretch of railway tracks.

221.title: We try to reach out to all but some leave after abusing us: Congress leader
221.article_body: Congress is a democratic party and it stands united, Congress' Jairam Ramesh said. "We try to take all people together. We try to reach out to all people but still, some leave after abusing us. I don't want to comment on them," Ramesh added. Furthermore, he said, "We don't silence voices. Those who are not satisfied issue statements. Some...write letters...tweet."

222.title: I feel like it’s a privilege: Mouni Roy on being part of 'Brahmastra'
222.article_body: Actress Mouni Roy has said that she feels it is a privilege to be a part of Ranbir Kapoor-starrer 'Brahmastra'. "It made so much of a difference in terms of the experience that I gained while shooting this film, the kinds of things that I have learned while shooting this film," she added. The film will also feature Alia Bhatt.

223.title: Ukraine's Shmyhal meets Germany's Scholz to discuss military aid
223.article_body: Ukrainian Prime Minister Denys Shmyhal met German Chancellor Olaf Scholz in Berlin on Sunday. Shmyhal acknowledged that Berlin stepped up military aid by providing heavy armaments like the howitzer 2000 and rocket launchers. Ukrainian PM, who was welcomed with military honours, is the first high-level Ukrainian official to visit Germany in several months.

224.title: Scam worth over ₹100 crore found in Madhya Pradesh govt's free food scheme: Report
224.article_body: According to a report by Madhya Pradesh's Accountant General, irregularities worth over ₹100 crore in the identification of beneficiaries and in the production and distribution of Take Home Ration (THR) have surfaced in the state's nutrition programme. Notably, even the trucks that were claimed to have been used for ration transportation were found to be motorcycles, cars, autos and tankers.

225.title: BBMP identifies 696 encroachments in Bengaluru, issues notices
225.article_body: The Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) has identified 696 encroachments in the city and issued notices to 32 people. The action comes after CM Basavaraj Bommai directed authorities to remove properties encroaching on the drains after he visited flooded areas. The highest number of 175 encroachments were reported in Mahadevapura area followed by 126 encroachments in Dasarahalli.

226.title: Tharoor met Gehlot to discuss about AICC Presidential polls: Reports
226.article_body: According to reports, senior Congress leader Shashi Tharoor met Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot in Delhi and discussed about the party's future as well as the upcoming AICC Presidential polls. Earlier last week, Gehlot had said that efforts will be made till the last minute to persuade Rahul Gandhi to take over the reins of the party again.

227.title: Some plunge into poll battle just 5 months earlier with huge promises: Shah
227.article_body: Union Minister Amit Shah on Sunday said that some people plunge into the poll battle just about five months earlier with huge promises against others who work hard for five years, before asking for votes. Shah made the remark in Ahmedabad without naming anyone. He inaugurated four smart schools in Ahmedabad city on Sunday.

228.title: Mumbai school principal to be conferred with National Award by President
228.article_body: Principal of a Mumbai school, Kavita Sanghvi, is set to be conferred with the National Award by President Droupadi Murmu on the occasion of Teacher’s Day. She joined 45 other educators from across the country in the honours list. “It’s going to be a very special event for me as it is recognition of my hard work,” said Sanghvi.

229.title: Las Vegas investigative journalist stabbed to death outside home
229.article_body: A 69-year-old investigative journalist, Jeff German, was stabbed to death outside his house in US' Las Vegas, authorities said. A police spokesperson said that police believe that an altercation had taken place, adding, "We do have some leads. We're pursuing a suspect but the suspect is outstanding." The city's Mayor Carolyn G Goodman called it a "senseless act of violence".

230.title: Speculative: Federal Bank on report claiming its merger with Kotak Bank
230.article_body: Reacting to a media report claiming its merger with Kotak Mahindra Bank, Federal Bank clarified that the report is "speculative in nature". In an exchange filing, it said that there was "no such information available with the company". Earlier, a report while quoting sources said that the top management of both banks had met for a potential deal.

231.title: I was scared about not wearing any makeup in 'Maharani': Huma Qureshi
231.article_body: Actress Huma Qureshi said she was scared about not wearing makeup in the series 'Maharani'. "In season 2, at least I'm the chief minister so I'm in better clothes. In season 1, I...had rubber slippers, dirty synthetic saree that I would pull up...tuck in (above the stomach)," she stated. Huma revealed she was "petrified" when she heard the show's script.

232.title: Kitten rescued from burning building in Ukraine; video surfaces
232.article_body: A video of firefighters rescuing a kitten from a burning building in Ukraine has surfaced online. According to the country's emergency services, the rescuers pulled out the kitten from the rubble of the hotel-restaurant complex that was hit by a rocket, which in turn had caused the fire, in Kharkiv. The video shows the firefighters petting and cuddling the kitten.

233.title: If we had more wickets in hand, I would've tried to hit more sixes: Kohli
233.article_body: Talking about his 60(44) against Pakistan, Virat Kohli said he made a "conscious effort to strike at a higher pace" but he ended up in a situation where he had to "go deep". He added, "When we lost wickets, there was communication and our plans changed...if there were a couple of batters, I would've gone with the same tempo."

234.title: Robbers pose as income tax officials, loot ₹25 lakh from Ludhiana farmer
234.article_body: Four men posed as income tax officials to raid the house of a Ludhiana farmer and seized ₹25 lakh before leaving. The victim stated in his complaint he had sold 21-acre land and kept part of the money at home to buy more land. He said some of the robbers were carrying pistols and locked the family in a room.

235.title: Church must show zero tolerance: Pope on sexual abuse by clergy
235.article_body: Pope Francis said during an interview on Sunday that the Catholic Church must show "zero tolerance" over sexual abuse by the clergy. "A priest cannot continue being a priest if he is an aggressor. He cannot because he is either sick or a criminal," he added. He further said that such an act is "monstrous" as it destroys lives.

236.title: Will speak to B'luru IT companies regarding ₹225 cr loss due to rain: CM Bommai
236.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai on Monday said that he will call Bengaluru-based IT and banking companies which said that they collectively lost ₹225 crore due to the flooding of Outer Ring Road. "I will speak with them related to issues they're facing (due to waterlogging). We'll also discuss the compensation and other related damages caused due to rain," he added.

237.title: BYJU'S to raise over $500 million at $23 billion valuation: Report
237.article_body: Edtech platform BYJU'S is likely to raise more than $500 million at a valuation of $23 billion in a week, PTI reported. BYJU'S is reportedly in talks with Abu Dhabi's sovereign wealth funds to raise $400-500 million and with Qatar Investment Authority (QIA) to raise $250-350 million. The company is mulling over using funds for acquisition in the US.

238.title: Last rites of Karnataka police dog conducted with full state honours
238.article_body: The Karnataka Police on Sunday conducted the last rites of a service dog who served the department for over 11 years with full state honours. Geetha, an 11-year-old labrador retriever dog, passed away on Saturday following prolonged illness. Geetha was deployed extensively in the security and explosive detection work during the arrival of VVIPs and other huge public gatherings..

239.title: Paytm shares fall over 6% in early trade after ED raid in Chinese loan apps probe
239.article_body: Shares of Paytm’s parent company One 97 Communications declined over 6% in Monday's early trade. The Enforcement Directorate had conducted a raid at the company's Bengaluru premises over the weekend in connection with a Chinese loan apps case. At the day's low of ₹681.20, the share price was trading at a discount of 68% from its issue price of ₹2,150.

240.title: Bed Bath & Beyond CFO was sued over $1.2bn loss to shareholders days before death
240.article_body: Bed Bath & Beyond CFO Gustavo Arnal, who died after jumping from NYC's 'Jenga Building' on Friday, was sued by a group of shareholders on August 23, court documents show. The lawsuit accused Arnal and major shareholder Ryan Cohen of artificially inflating the firm's stock price through a 'pump and dump' scheme. The shareholders claimed they lost around $1.2 billion.

241.title: Why is he sitting on CM post?: Annie Raja on Soren's 'incidents happen' remark
241.article_body: General Secretary of National Federation of Indian Women (NFIW) Annie Raja criticised Jharkhand CM Hemant Soren for his "incidents happen" remark while responding to a question on a tribal girl’s rape and murder in Dumka. "Why is he sitting on the CM post? He is there to ensure that this kind of incident is prevented," Raja said.

242.title: Lucknow man arrested for 'love jihad', raping, assaulting wife
242.article_body: A 39-year-old gym owner in Lucknow has been arrested for marrying a woman by allegedly concealing his identity and posing as a Hindu man. The accused married her in a temple and later forced her to change her religion, threatening her with dire consequences, police said. The victim has further accused him of rape and having unnatural sex with her.

243.title: Euro declines below $0.99 for the first time in 20 years
243.article_body: The euro fell below $0.99 for the first time in 20 years on Monday, after Russia shut down a major gas pipeline to Europe. The currency fell as much as 0.7% to a low of $0.9888 in afternoon trading in Asia. Earlier, the US dollar index hit 110.086 in Asia's morning trade, reaching a new two-decade high.

244.title: Azad twisting facts, distorting history to gain sympathy from people of J&K: Cong
244.article_body: Congress General Secretary of Communications Jairam Ramesh said that former Congress leader Ghulam Nabi Azad is twisting facts and distorting history in order to generate undue sympathy from the people of Jammu and Kashmir. He further said Azad's claims of being a politician connected with people is a lie, adding he never won any election other than an assembly by-election.

245.title: MBT member posts fake news about Raja Singh, detained in Hyderabad
245.article_body: A member of the political party Majlis Bachao Tehreek (MBT) was detained in Hyderabad for allegedly posting fake news about suspended BJP leader T Raja Singh. The accused had claimed in the post that Singh, who has been jailed under the Preventive Detention Act, will be released on Monday. Singh was jailed after being accused of insulting Prophet Muhammad.

246.title: 2 killed, at least 5 trapped in fire at Hotel Levana in Lucknow
246.article_body: Two people were killed after a fire broke out in Hotel Levana in Uttar Pradesh's Lucknow. Reports said that 20 people have been rescued. However, five to six people are still feared trapped inside the hotel building. The fire broke out on Monday morning. Eyewitnesses said that several guests tried escaping the hotel by breaking the windows of their rooms.

247.title: Working on 'Aashiqui 3' is like dream come true: Actor Kartik Aaryan
247.article_body: Actor Kartik Aaryan, who will be featuring in 'Aashiqui 3', has said that working on the film is a "dream come true" for him. "The timeless classic 'Aashiqui' is something I grew up watching...I feel privileged yet grateful for collaborating with Bhushan Kumar and Mukesh Bhatt for this opportunity," he added. The film will be directed by Anurag Basu.

248.title: Gurugram's Appu Ghar sealed over non payment of dues of over ₹48.56 cr
248.article_body: The Haryana Shehri Vikas Pradhikaran (HSVP) has sealed Appu Ghar amusement park in Gurugram over alleged non-payment of dues of over ₹48.56 crore including penalties. An official said several notices had been served to the amusement park authorities and that they have defaulted on the payment. The park operator's lease agreement was also terminated earlier.

249.title: Mumbai businessman booked for allegedly forging ID card of DRDO
249.article_body: Mumbai police has booked a 72-year-old businessman for possessing a fake identity card of the Defence Research and Development Organisation (DRDO). The man allegedly created the bogus ID to get his work done quickly at the passport office. He was booked for pretending to be an official and carrying a token used by officials with fraudulent intent.

250.title: Mumbai Traffic Police asked not to use personal phones for snapping violators
250.article_body: The Additional Director General of Police (Traffic) issued notification warning Mumbai Traffic Police against use of personal mobile phones to issue e-challans to violators. The ADG asked traffic police to use cameras on the e-challan machines to click photos. There were several complaints that vehicle photos clicked on personal mobile phones were not appropriate and uploaded late, the ADG said.

251.title: K'taka government to investigate scams under Congress rule: Ravi
251.article_body: BJP National General Secretary CT Ravi claimed that the Karnataka government will investigate all the scams that took place under the previous Congress regime. "Many scams during the Congress government have been covered up. There was a long discussion in the meeting about uncovering and investigating such scams and taking strict action against the culprits," said Ravi.

252.title: SpaceX launches 51 Starlink satellites in its 40th mission of 2022
252.article_body: SpaceX has successfully launched a batch of 51 Starlink satellites completing its 40th mission of 2022. Seattle-based company Spaceflight's space tug Sherpa-LTC2 was also onboard with the Starlink satellites. Last week, SpaceX CEO Elon Musk said the firm is launching Starlink satellites roughly every five days now and plans to launch 100 orbital missions in 2023.

253.title: 8 die climbing volcano in Russia, strong winds delay rescue
253.article_body: Eight people lost their lives while climbing the Klyuchevskaya Sopka volcano in Russia's far east, according to Interfax news agency. A group of 12 people, including two guides, had set out to climb a 4,754 metre volcano on Tuesday but some climbers fell from 4,200 metres, authorities said. Rescuers returned amid strong winds which prevented their helicopter from landing.

254.title: Have finally seen every shot in Brahmāstra, emotional moment for me: Ayan
254.article_body: Taking to Instagram, 'Brahmāstra' director Ayan Mukerji shared a behind-the-scenes clip from the sets of the film. Along with the video, Ayan wrote, "Yesterday was the first time, I saw every shot in 'Brahmāstra' - finally finished, polished and ready for its audience." He added that it was an emotional moment for him as the journey was "long and challenging".

255.title: Strong speech: Tharoor after Rahul addressed Congress' rally in Delhi
255.article_body: After Congress leader Rahul Gandhi addressed the ‘Mehangai par halla bol’ rally in Delhi on Sunday, Congress' Shashi Tharoor tweeted "strong speech". Tharoor added, "A strong speech...roused huge crowds thronging Ramlila Maidan. Now to take message across the country in Bharat Jodo Yatra." Gandhi in his speech said, "I want to tell PM Modi, I'm not scared of your ED."

256.title: India reports 5,910 new COVID-19 cases and 16 deaths, positivity rate at 2.60%
256.article_body: India has reported 5,910 new COVID-19 cases and nine deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Health Ministry. Additionally, seven reconciled deaths from earlier period were added in Kerala. This comes a day after the country recorded 6,809 COVID-19 cases. Active cases in the country dropped to 53,974, while the daily positivity rate stood at 2.60%.

257.title: Just stared at ceiling till 5 am, thought my career is over: Kohli on CT 2009 match vs Pak
257.article_body: On being asked about Arshdeep Singh being criticised for dropping a catch against Pakistan in Asia Cup match, Virat Kohli said, "Everyone makes mistakes under pressure." He stated, "I remember...I got out playing...bad shot against Shahid Afridi in my first Champions Trophy match in 2009." He added, "[After the match]...I just stared at...ceiling till 5 am...thought my career is over."

258.title: Rohit Sharma gets angry at Rishabh Pant in dressing room after his wicket, video viral
258.article_body: A video of Team India captain Rohit Sharma getting angry at Rishabh Pant after the latter's dismissal against Pakistan in their Asia Cup 2022 Super 4 stage match has gone viral. In the video, Rohit can be seen seemingly scolding Pant about his shot selection. Pant was dismissed for 14(12) after playing a reverse sweep against Shadab Khan.

259.title: Shame on people saying cheap things about him: Harbhajan on Arshdeep getting abused
259.article_body: Ex-India off-spinner Harbhajan Singh took to Twitter to defend pacer Arshdeep Singh after he was abused on social media for dropping a catch against Pakistan during India's five-wicket defeat on Sunday. "Stop criticising young Arshdeep...No one [drops] the catch purposely...Shame on...people who [are] putting our own guys down by saying cheap things...about Arsh and team...Arsh is GOLD," he added.

260.title: I'll always wear seat belt, even when in rear seat: Mahindra after Mistry's death
260.article_body: Businessman Anand Mahindra tweeted, "I resolve to always wear my seat belt even when in the rear seat of the car," after former Tata Sons Chairman Cyrus Mistry was killed in a road accident near Mumbai on Sunday. Mistry was in the backseat and wasn't wearing his seat belt when the overspeeding car hit a divider, preliminary police probe found.

261.title: Traffic restrictions in Mumbai's western suburbs due to VVIP visit
261.article_body: Mumbai police has rolled out traffic restrictions due to a scheduled VVIP visit. The movement will be slow at Malabar Hill, Babulnath, Kemp's Corner, Haji Ali, Mahalaxmi Race Course, Saat Rasta, Chinchpokli Junction, Lalbaug Parel, Lotus Junction, Worli Dairy, Worli Sea Link and Lilavati Junction areas between 9 am to 12:30 pm.

262.title: Woman constable booked in Punjab's Mohali for cheating, impersonation
262.article_body: A woman constable posted with Cyber Crime Cell has been booked in Punjab's Mohali for allegedly impersonating another police personnel and lodging fake complaints with senior officers. The accused lodged complaints in order to defame the personnel, police said. The incident came to light when an inquiry was conducted by an ADGP level officer following which the case was registered.

263.title: Man climbs one of the tallest buildings in UK, shares selfie from the top; arrested
263.article_body: A 21-year-old man was arrested on suspicion of trespass in London after he was seen climbing one of the tallest buildings in the UK on Sunday. The man, believed to be free climber Adam Lockwood, scaled the 1,017 ft-tall skyscraper, called 'The Shard', barefoot. He later posted a selfie on Facebook from the top of the building, captioned, "Shard, 04/09/2022."

264.title: Tamil Nadu minister V Senthil Balaji's Twitter account hacked briefly
264.article_body: Tamil Nadu Minister of Electricity, Prohibition and Excise V Senthil Balaji's Twitter account was briefly hacked on Sunday but got restored later in the day. The account showed a different display name and requested people to make use of cryptocurrencies. He later thanked state cyber crime wing and Twitter officials for restoring his account which has over two lakh followers.

265.title: Most sedition cases in last 8 years came from Assam: NCRB data
265.article_body: A National Crime Records Bureau (NCRB) report stated that 76 sedition cases were registered across the country in 2021 which is a marginal increase from the 73 registered in 2020. Most of the sedition cases in the last eight years have come from Assam, the report stated. The number of cases stood at 93 in 2019 and 70 in 2018.

266.title: Restoration of full statehood of J&K, right to land priority: Azad
266.article_body: Veteran politician Ghulam Nabi Azad, who recently quit Congress citing Rahul Gandhi's "immaturity", has stated that the restoration of full statehood of Jammu and Kashmir will be the priority of his new party. He said that no one from outside Jammu and Kashmir shall be allowed to purchase land there and no jobs shall go to outsiders.

267.title: Boat carrying 55 people capsizes in Ganga river in Bihar's Danapur, 10 people missing
267.article_body: A boat carrying 55 people capsized in Bihar's Danapur on Sunday. Reports said that 10 people are missing and the search operation is underway. The incident took place while the labourers were returning from work. News agency ANI reported that people gathered around the river soon after the news of the sinking of the boat spread.

268.title: World no. 1 Medvedev crashes out of US Open, loses to Kyrgios
268.article_body: Defending champion and world number one Daniil Medvedev has crashed out of the US Open after losing to Australian Nick Kyrgios in their round-of-16 match. Notably, this is the first time Kyrgios has reached the quarterfinals at Flushing Meadows. "I want to go all the way," said Kyrgios after winning the match with a scoreline of 7-6(13-11), 3-6, 6-3, 6-2.

269.title: Thunderstorms cause flash floods in US' Georgia; emergency declared
269.article_body: Thunderstorms and heavy rainfall caused flash flooding in US' Georgia, following which the state Governor Brian P Kemp declared a state of emergency in Chattooga and Floyd Counties. According to Kemp's order, the area received an estimated 12 inches of rainfall which caused rivers to "rise rapidly". The National Weather Service said that the situation is "extremely dangerous and life-threatening".

270.title: Hardcore, loyal Shiv Sainiks will fight back: Ex-Maha CM Thackeray
270.article_body: Former Maharashtra CM and Shiv Sena chief Uddhav Thackeray on Sunday said "loyal and hardcore" Shiv Sainiks will fight back against the current political situation. Thackeray was addressing the members of the Vahatuk Sena, the transport wing of the party, at his residence. Thackeray said he has received 11,000 new membership forms and affidavits from the Vahatuk Sena.

271.title: Anand & 1.5L other Indians managed genetic hair fall: Traya
271.article_body: Anand from Nashik covered his bald patch in 5 months, shared Traya, revealing that it has found a breakthrough in managing genetic hairfall. Internal factors like stress, nutrition and digestion accelerate balding, therefore it combines 3 sciences- ayurveda, dermatology and nutrition to target these root causes, Traya stated. It offers an online hair test to build a customized treatment plan.

272.title: Bengaluru Police shares list of roads to avoid due to waterlogging
272.article_body: As heavy rain lashed out Bengaluru, the HSR Layout Traffic Police shared list of roads to avoid due to waterlogging and suggested people to use alternative roads. The police asked commuters to avoid - Outer Ring Road, Sarjapura road, Doddakannelli road, Bellandur road. The Outer Ring Road (ORR) was flooded for the second time in a week.

273.title: Cyrus Mistry was brought dead with a head injury after accident: Doctor
273.article_body: Former Tata Sons Chairman Cyrus Mistry was brought dead to the hospital and had received a head injury during the accident, said a doctor who attended to him at a government hospital in Kasa. He added that his co-passenger Jehangir Pandole died during the transit. According to the police, the accident happened as the driver lost control because of overspeeding.

274.title: Carnival swing with 50 people on board crashes down from 50 feet in Punjab; video surfaces
274.article_body: A swing with nearly 50 people on board broke mid-air and crashed down from a height of 50 feet during a fair in Punjab's Mohali on Sunday, ANI reported. According to The Indian Express, at least 15 people, mostly children and women, were injured in the incident. The injured persons were shifted to a hospital after the incident, reports said.

275.title: People trying to give Patkar backdoor entry into Guj politics: Shah
275.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah has criticised AAP, claiming that some people were trying to give activist Medha Patkar a "backdoor entry" into Gujarat politics. "Those who want to bring...Patkar, who opposed Gujarat and our lifeline Narmada project...should stop here itself. There's no place for those opposing Gujarat," he added. Patkar was fielded by AAP in 2014 Lok Sabha elections.

276.title: Out of all I've played with before, only MSD messaged me when I quit Test captaincy: Kohli
276.article_body: During a press conference after India-Pakistan match on Sunday, Virat Kohli said out of all the players he has played with before, only MS Dhoni messaged him when he quit Test captaincy. "A lot of [other former] players have my number...A lot of people give suggestions on TV...but no one messaged me," he added, taking a dig at his critics.

277.title: This game was as valuable as a final: Rizwan on Pak's win vs India
277.article_body: After defeating India in their Asia Cup Super 4 stage match, Pakistan wicketkeeper-batter Muhammad Rizwan said the game was as valuable as a final to them. "The whole world [was] watching...we have power-hitters who are capable of hitting around 45 runs off the last four overs. So we didn't panic," he added. Pakistan chased down India's 181-run total to win.

278.title: Road caves in due to heavy rainfall in Kerala's Wayanad, video surfaces
278.article_body: A part of a road caved in, in Kerala's Wayanad district, as heavy rainfall lashed the area. A video of the incident has surfaced. In the video, several people can be seen walking towards the part of the road that got washed away with flowing water. Reports added that all paddy fields have been flooded due to heavy rainfall.

279.title: Fire breaks out at Lucknow's Hotel Levana; rescue ops on, 3 ambulances on standby
279.article_body: A fire broke out at Hotel Levana in Uttar Pradesh's Lucknow on Monday. News agency ANI reported that firefighting and rescue operations are underway. Three ambulances and fire tenders are present at the spot. Meanwhile, security personnel are taking the help of oxygen masks to enter the building to evacuate people stuck in their hotel rooms.

280.title: Fire breaks out near Delhi's Chandni Chowk, over 100 fire officers deployed
280.article_body: A fire broke out in a building near the Chandni Chowk metro station in Delhi on Sunday night. Reports said that over 100 fire officers have been deployed and 35 fire tenders are present on the spot. An official said that the fire has been doused and cooling is being done from outside.

281.title: Mistry & Pandoles were returning from a Parsi pilgrimage site when accident occurred
281.article_body: Former Tata Sons Chairman Cyrus Mistry was accompanied by his three family friends from the Pandole family when the accident occurred. They were returning from a Parsi pilgrimage site in Udwada, where they had gone to offer prayers following the death of Darius and Jehangir Pandole's father Dinshaw Pandole last week. Jehangir and Mistry didn't survive the accident.

282.title: BJP wanted to make RCP Singh Bihar's Eknath Shinde: Nitish Kumar
282.article_body: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar on Sunday said BJP wanted to make ex-JD(U) leader RCP Singh the Eknath Shinde of Bihar and isolate the JD(U) party. Earlier, after the collapse of the MVA government in Maharashtra, Shinde was sworn in as the CM. Kumar’s statement came during the national executive council meeting of JD(U) which was held in Patna.

283.title: Problems of India don't feature in B'wood films now: Pallavi Joshi
283.article_body: Speaking about Bollywood films not working, 'The Kashmir Files' actress Pallavi Joshi opined that the films don't feature India's problems, due to which there is a disconnect with the audience. "If you see the films of Raj Kapoor, Manoj Kumar, Sunil Dutt, they mirrored whatever was happening around in the society," she said. 'The Kashmir Files' also featured Anupam Kher.

284.title: First metro pier comes up inside Bengaluru airport campus
284.article_body: The first metro pier inside premises of Bengaluru's Kempegowda International Airport was cast on Saturday. The 15-km-long route from Yelahanka to the Airport terminal station will have a total of 67 piers. Casting of the first pier, which has a height of 8 metres and a diameter running to 1.6 metres, was completed within three hours, officials said.

285.title: Rohit Sharma's 'angry' reaction to Arshdeep dropping catch against Pakistan goes viral
285.article_body: India captain Rohit Sharma's reaction to pacer Arshdeep Singh dropping Asif Ali's catch in 18th over of Pakistan's innings in their Asia Cup 2022 Super 4 stage match went viral. In the video, Rohit can be seen reacting furiously. Asif was batting on 0* when Arshdeep dropped his catch on Ravi Bishnoi's bowling. Asif went on to score 16(8).

286.title: Rachakonda CP calls for cooperation over immersion of Ganesh idols
286.article_body: Rachakonda CP Mahesh Bhagwat on Sunday urged devotees to cooperate with the police to complete the immersion of Ganesh idols peacefully. He also inspected the arrangements for the same at Saroornagar lake, saying that "full-proof" arrangements have been made by police. He added that the police will work round the clock in Rachakonda limits till immersion reach the last phase.

287.title: 'I'm devastated by the horrific attacks', says Canada PM Trudeau as 10 stabbed to death
287.article_body: Canada's Prime Minister Justin Trudeau has said, "I am shocked and devastated by the horrific attacks today in James Smith Cree Nation and Weldon, Saskatchewan, that claimed the lives of 10 people and injured many more." He added, "As Canadians, we mourn with everyone affected by this tragic violence, and with the people of Saskatchewan."

288.title: Virat's form is brilliant, his 60(44) vs Pak was crucial for the team: Rohit
288.article_body: Team India captain Rohit Sharma praised Virat Kohli for his 60-run innings against Pakistan in their Asia Cup match on Sunday. "Needed someone to bat long when the others were getting out. Virat batted with that tempo...Virat getting that score was crucial from the team's point of view," said Rohit. India posted 181/7 but lost the match by five wickets.

289.title: Who are the Pandoles, Cyrus Mistry's co-passengers during the road accident?
289.article_body: Former Tata Sons Chairman Cyrus Mistry was accompanied by three family friends during the accident. While the car was driven by Dr Anahita Pandole, a top gynaecologist in Mumbai, her husband Darius Pandole, JM Financial Private Equity's CEO, was seated in front. Darius' brother, Jehangir, a top executive at KPMG, was seated in the back and didn't survive the accident.

290.title: BEST imposes ₹3 crore fine on pvt agency for keeping mini AC buses off roads
290.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Electric Supply and Transport (BEST) imposed a fine of ₹3 crore on a private agency, two days after 280 mini air-conditioned BEST buses, that have been wet-leased from the private agency, went off the roads. Wet-leased buses are owned by private contractors, who also appoint their drivers and take care of maintenance and insurance of the vehicles.

291.title: 69 fatal spots mapped in Delhi saw 5 accidents per km in last 2 years: Data
291.article_body: The Delhi Transport Department has identified about 69 fatal crash spots across the city. Reports said that these fatal spots have seen more than five accidents per kilometre in the last two years. The data also shows that there are about five corridors which have seen more than two pedestrian deaths per kilometre.

292.title: Cyrus Mistry was not wearing a seat belt, car covered 20km in 9 minutes: Police
292.article_body: Former Tata Sons Chairman Cyrus Mistry was not wearing a seat belt when the car he was travelling in hit a divider, killing him and his co-passenger Jahangir Pandole, preliminary police probe found. The car was overspeeding and had covered 20km in just 9 minutes, police said. Mistry and Pandole, who were sitting in the backseat, suffered injuries to head.

293.title: 10 killed, 15 hospitalised in mass stabbing incident in Canada
293.article_body: At least 10 people were killed and 15 others were hospitalised after a stabbing spree in Saskatchewan province in Canada on Sunday. Police said they were investigating 13 locations and looking for two "armed and dangerous" suspects. While some of the victims seem to have been targeted by the suspects, others may have been attacked randomly, the police further said.

294.title: 4 members of same family booked for assaulting bus driver in Pune
294.article_body: The driver of a Pune Mahanagar Parivahan Mahamandal Limited (PMPML) bus was allegedly assaulted by four members of a family in an incident of road rage on Shankarsheth Road in Pune. Police have booked the accused family members, who had also allegedly verbally abused the conductor and ticket supervisor of the bus.

295.title: Rashford scores 2 as Man Utd hand Arsenal their 1st defeat in PL this season
295.article_body: Marcus Rashford scored a brace as Manchester United beat Premier League leaders Arsenal 3-1 to hand the London club their first loss of the season. United's €100m summer signing, Antony started the match and opened the scoring for the home team in the 35th minute. Arsenal's Bukayo Saka equalised in the 60th minute, before Rashford's brace won United the match.

296.title: Pakistan beat India in Asia Cup, record their highest successful T20I chase against them
296.article_body: Pakistan on Sunday handed India their first defeat in Asia Cup 2022 by registering a five-wicket victory in their Super 4 stage match. Pakistan chased down a target of 182 in 19.5 overs to record their highest-ever successful run chase in T20I cricket against India. Muhammad Rizwan top-scored for Pakistan in the match with 71 runs off 51 deliveries.

297.title: Draft order for Gorakhpur changes 'Muslim-sounding names' of wards
297.article_body: A draft delimitation order by UP's Gorakhpur Municipal Corporation has changed "Muslim-sounding names" of wards in the district. Mayor Sitaram Jaiswal said the new names evoke a feeling of pride with Ilahi Bagh now known as Bandhu Singh Nagar, Ismailpur as Sahabganj and other such changes. An official said objections to the order can be filed within a week.

298.title: Back-to-back 50s, this one is better than the other: Mishra on Kohli's 60
298.article_body: Reacting to India batter Virat Kohli's 60 off 44 deliveries against Pakistan in Super 4 stage match at Asia Cup 2022, Amit Mishra said, "Back-to-back half-centuries...this one is better than the other." He tweeted, "Placed his innings with calculated aggression and some good quality shots. GOAT for a reason." Kohli scored 59* (44) against Hong Kong in group stage match.

299.title: Kabir Bedi conferred with Lifetime Achievement Award at Venice
299.article_body: Kabir Bedi was honoured on Saturday with the Filming Italy Movie Lifetime Achievement Award at Venice. Bedi, who has done over six major series in Italy, said not many people realise that "Bollywood and Hollywood are a far lesser part of my life than my career in Italy". He thanked Italians for giving him the opportunity to star in 'Sandokan'.

300.title: My journey is 70% failure, 30% success: Rubina Dilaik
300.article_body: Rubina Dilaik described her journey as a mix of "70% failure and 30% success". She said she believes it is "important to fail otherwise one wouldn't understand the meaning of success". Rubina, who said her priority is to do "impactful work", added that if television offers her "creatively satisfying" projects, she will always choose to come back to the medium.

301.title: You screwed me: Lewis Hamilton to Mercedes on finishing 4th
301.article_body: Mercedes F1 driver Lewis Hamilton went on an expletive-filled rant during the 2022 Dutch GP as he lost his race lead to end fourth. "That was the biggest f**k up. I can't believe you screwed me like that. I can't describe how pi**ed I am," Hamilton said on the team radio. Red Bull's Max Verstappen won the Grand Prix.

302.title: Filmmakers used to call me finest, but nothing translated into work: Shefali
302.article_body: Shefali Shah said that her potential as an actress was "not tapped well" before 'Delhi Crime'. The actress said that while she had always received appreciation, it never translated into work. "There were directors and filmmakers who used to say I am the finest actress but then nothing in terms of getting work," she said.

303.title: Keita, Chamberlain left out of Liverpool's UCL group stage squad
303.article_body: Liverpool midfielders Naby Keita and Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain have been left out of the club's 2022-23 UEFA Champions League group stage squad. Both players are suffering from a muscle injury and are ineligible to be added again until January. Liverpool will travel to Napoli for their Champions League Group A opening match on September 7.

304.title: Azad twisting facts in his favour to befool people of J&K: Congress
304.article_body: Congress on Sunday hit back at Ghulam Nabi Azad accusing him of working at the behest of his "political bosses". Congress general secretary Jairam Ramesh said that Azad was twisting facts to befool the people of J&K. It doesn't make sense for Azad to spread lies in public after parting ways with Congress, he said.

305.title: Ralph Lauren shares pics of JLo's 3 wedding gowns that featured pearls, crystals
305.article_body: Designer Ralph Lauren has shared new details and pictures of the three custom-made gowns that actress Jennifer Lopez wore during her second wedding with actor Ben Affleck. She walked down the aisle in a gown made with over 1,000 hand-cut handkerchiefs using 1,640 feet of fabric. The other two gowns featured silk tulle, pearls and Swarovski crystals, the designer said.

306.title: Haven’t made any monetary gains from ‘Kala Chashma’ buzz: Singer Amar
306.article_body: Singer Amar Arshi said that while his song 'Kala Chashma' is trending on the internet, he hasn't made "any monetary gains from it". He said many people don't even know that the original version of the song, which was released in 1991, was sung by him. "I didn't think the song will become this big," he added.

307.title: Virat Kohli's 6-week-long break has helped him: Ravi Shastri
307.article_body: Former India head coach Ravi Shastri said the six-week-long break Virat Kohli took by skipping the West Indies and Zimbabwe tours has had a positive impact. "Kohli looks a lot calmer, he needed that break," said Shastri. Kohli has scored 154 runs with two half-centuries in the three Asia Cup 2022 matches he has played so far.

308.title: Fundamentalists trying to influence, but Muslims have cooperated: Assam DGP
308.article_body: Assam DGP Bhaskar Jyoti Mahanta said that four main organisations running most of the madrasas in the state have been told to conduct a survey of the institutions within six months. "Fundamentalist forces are trying to influence [Assam's] Muslims...but the community, by and large, have cooperated, with only a minuscule percentage falling prey to the radical doctrines," Mahanta said.

309.title: 13 sand-laden tractors cross Agra toll plaza within 50 seconds by breaking barrier
309.article_body: As many as 13 sand-laden tractor-trolleys of alleged mining mafia broke the barricading at a toll plaza on the Agra-Gwalior highway in Uttar Pradesh and reportedly crossed it within 52 seconds. According to Agra Police, a case has been registered in this connection and further legal action is being undertaken. CCTV footage of the incident has surfaced online.

310.title: 3 labourers run over by train in Punjab's Ludhiana
310.article_body: Three labourers were run over by a train when they were trying to cross a rail track near Dhandari Kalan in Punjab's Ludhiana district on Sunday. The deceased labourers are yet to be identified and all of them died on the spot, a Government Railway Police official said. The deceased labourers were run over by the Ludhiana-Ambala passenger train.

311.title: I am declared dead in govt records, couldn't even withdraw pension: 70-year-old UP man
311.article_body: A 70-year-old man in Uttar Pradesh's Shahjahanpur district claimed he's being denied old-age pension as he has been "declared dead" in government records. "As I'm dead in government records...I couldn't even withdraw money from bank. My cane crop is affected as I couldn't irrigate it due to lack of money," he said. Officials stated that they are probing the matter.

312.title: Incidents happen, where don't they: Jharkhand CM on 14-yr-old tribal girl's rape, murder
312.article_body: Responding to questions on a 14-year-old tribal girl's rape and murder in Dumka, Jharkhand Chief Minister Hemant Soren said, "Incidents happen...where do they not occur?" He added, "Incidents don’t come with a warning." The body of the girl was found hanging from a tree on Saturday. The accused, Armaan Ansari, was arrested on Sunday.

313.title: The view that India shouldn't interfere in world's problems must change: Jaishankar
313.article_body: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar has said the idea that India shouldn't interfere if any problem arises in the world, is a "dogma" that must change. "Maybe in 1950-60, we didn't have the capability (to interfere)...But now...we've reached number five in the world in economy," said Jaishankar. An entity ranked number five shouldn't think like one ranked 20, he added.

314.title: Hitting half-century with a 6, King Kohli style: Raina on Kohli's 60 vs Pak
314.article_body: After Virat Kohli hit a 44-ball 60 against Pakistan in the Super 4 stage match at Asia Cup 2022 today, Suresh Raina tweeted, "Hitting a half-century with a six, King Kohli style." "Playing with such calm and aggression at the same time, good going brother," he added. Notably, it is the 33-year-old Team India batter's 32nd T20I fifty.

315.title: Filmmakers making 'bakwas' content, not investing in stories: Prakash on B'wood
315.article_body: Filmmaker Prakash Jha said Bollywood is relying on making remakes. "They are just making remakes. If you don't have [an original] story to tell, stop making films," he said. He added that filmmakers need to understand that they are "making bakwas (crap)" and "not investing in stories and content". He added the makers need to work hard and "think original".

316.title: I can adopt, I can do IVF, I am open to everything: Vidyut on parenthood
316.article_body: Actor Vidyut Jammwal, who got engaged to fashion designer Nandita Mahtani, opened up about his views on parenthood. He said that children are a "divine plan" and he's open to all ways of having a child. "I can adopt, I can do IVF, surrogacy," he added. "If it's meant to be in your life, it'll come to you," said Vidyut.

317.title: 16 idols stolen from ancient Jain temple in UP's Lalitpur
317.article_body: Sixteen idols and their four umbrellas were stolen from the ancient Jain temple located in Paroli village in Lalitpur, UP on Saturday. A case has been registered against unknown thieves and an investigation has been launched, police said. Notably, a team from the Narhat Police Station, personnel from the Special Operations Group and surveillance are being deployed in the case.

318.title: Woman poisons Class 8 boy as he secured more marks than her son
318.article_body: A woman allegedly killed the classmate of her son because he'd scored more marks than her son in the school examination in  Puducherry. The woman allegedly mixed poison pills in a soft drink and gave it to the school watchman, asking him to give it to the boy. The woman has been detained, while the Class 8 boy has died.

319.title: Several injured as Radha Soami followers, Nihang Sikhs clash in Punjab
319.article_body: A clash broke out between followers of the Radha Soami Satsang Beas (RSSB) and Nihang Sikhs in Punjab on Sunday evening, following which around six people sustained injuries, according to police. "No death has been reported so far," Amritsar SSP (Rural) Swapan Sharma said. He added that at least six rounds were fired in the air.

320.title: Yogendra Yadav resigns from Samyukta Kisan Morcha coordination committee
320.article_body: Social activist Yogendra Yadav on Sunday resigned from Samyukta Kisan Morcha (SKM) coordination committee. However, he said, he will be in touch with other movements as well, apart from the farmers' movement. "It is important that the energies of all movements and opposition political parties be joined to fight against the anti-farmer Modi government," he said.

321.title: Radhika Madan's 'Kacchey Limbu' to premiere at 47th Toronto Film Festival
321.article_body: Actress Radhika Madan's 'Kacchey Limbu' is all set to premiere at the 47th Toronto International Film Festival. She shared the teaser of the film on her Instagram handle with a caption that read, "#KaccheyLimbu gears for its World Premiere at the 47th Toronto Film Festival Gala presentation @tiff_net on 11th September 2022." The film is directed by Shubham Yogi.

322.title: Congress' 'Halla bol' rally is 'Rahul Gandhi relaunch 4.0': BJP
322.article_body: As Congress held a 'Mahangai Par Halla Bol' rally in Delhi, BJP spokesperson Rajyavardhan Singh Rathore said, "This rally is 'Rahul Gandhi relaunch 4.0' as no one wants to lead Congress." Rathore added that this rally is meant to save the family and not to protest against the price rise. The rally was addressed by Gandhi and other Congress leaders.

323.title: Mistry desired to keep contributing to India's economic progress: Nirmala
323.article_body: Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said that the death of the former Chairman of the Tata Sons, Cyrus Mistry, comes as a "shock" to her. "He (Mistry) was committed to carrying forward and strengthening his business in infra and infra projects. He desired to keep contributing to India's economic progress. Condolences to his family and friends," Sitharaman said.

324.title: Smart selection: Manjrekar on Hooda's inclusion in India's squad vs Pakistan
324.article_body: Commenting on all-rounder Deepak Hooda's inclusion in India's playing XI against Pakistan in Super 4 stage match at Asia Cup 2022, Sanjay Manjrekar tweeted, "Smart selection by India." He added, "Hooda [is] in to keep depth in batting plus the option of the sixth bowler. No Dinesh Karthik, but Rishabh Pant stays for...left handed element." Hooda scored 16 (14) today.

325.title: Sushant Singh Rajput fan, who threatened to kill producer Sandeep Singh, arrested in Bihar
325.article_body: The police arrested a college dropout in Bihar for allegedly sending threat messages to film producer Sandeep Singh on social media earlier this year. The accused, identified as 21-year-old Krishna Kumar Singh, told police he is a fan of Sushant Singh Rajput and was "apparently angry" with Sandeep for what he had said in the media about the late actor.

326.title: Man who sued Nirvana over his naked baby pic on album cover, loses case
326.article_body: American rock band Nirvana has won the dismissal of a lawsuit filed by a man who claimed that the band using a picture of his naked four-month-old self was child pornography. Spencer Elden was featured swimming naked on the cover of a 1991 Nirvana album. Elden waited too long to allege that Nirvana sexually exploited him, the judge ruled.

327.title: Virat Kohli breaks world record for most 50+ scores in T20I cricket history
327.article_body: Former Team India captain Virat Kohli on Sunday broke the world record for registering most 50-plus scores in T20I cricket history, achieving the feat in the Asia Cup Super 4 stage match against Pakistan. Kohli's 60(44) against Pakistan is his 32nd 50-plus score in T20I cricket. He overtook compatriot Rohit Sharma, who has registered 50-plus scores 31 times.

328.title: You are loved, you are missed: Rakul on Rishi's birth anniversary
328.article_body: Rakul Preet Singh took to Instagram Stories on Sunday to share a post remembering late actor Rishi Kapoor on his birth anniversary. Sharing an old picture of Rishi, she wrote, "You are loved, You are missed, You are remembered, Always." Earlier today, Rishi's actress-wife Neetu Kapoor and his daughter Riddhima Kapoor Sahni also remembered him on his 70th birth anniversary.

329.title: Sorry for what's happened but not our problem: Juventus CEO on Ronaldo
329.article_body: Juventus CEO Maurizio Arrivabene said that they sympathise with Cristiano Ronaldo's struggles at Manchester United but it does not bother them. "We are sorry for what's happened to him in Manchester this year, but it's not our problem," he said. The Portuguese star has started just once in five league games this season and is yet to score a goal.

330.title: People with BJP are 'sadachari', those against are 'bhrashtachari': Bihar CM
330.article_body: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar on Sunday criticised the BJP and said that those that support the party are considered "sadachari" and those who speak against the party are "bhrashtachari". JD(U) charged the BJP-led central government with imposing an "undeclared emergency" in the country, "misusing" probe agencies to silence opposition voices and stoking "communal frenzy" in society.

331.title: Man arrested in Lucknow for marrying woman after lying he's Hindu
331.article_body: A gym operator has been arrested in Lucknow for marrying a woman after allegedly lying to her that he's Hindu. The couple reportedly married in a temple and the woman came to know that the man is Muslim when he forced her to convert. The man also allegedly threatened the woman with dire consequences if she told her family.

332.title: Williams sisters made me believe superheroes are real: Lewis Hamilton
332.article_body: Seven-time F1 world champion Lewis Hamilton said Serena Williams and Venus Williams made him believe that superheroes are real, and they can look like him. He thanked Serena for making him better in every way and said she will "always have a brother" in him. Lewis said he "never dreamed" he would call the sisters his friends.

333.title: Parineeti Chopra to help clean up Mumbai beaches post Ganpati Visarjan
333.article_body: Actress Parineeti Chopra has decided to clean up beaches in Mumbai after Ganesh Chaturthi celebrations. She said every year during Ganpati Visarjan, people "leave behind immense litter" on beaches which ends up in water. "This...can cause mass deaths of...marine animals," Parineeti added while urging people to join her to clean the Juhu beach post the Ganpati Visarjan on September 10.

334.title: I'd love to play for KKR if they build a women's IPL team: Richa Ghosh
334.article_body: On being asked which women's IPL team she aspires to play for, India Women wicketkeeper-batter Richa Ghosh said, "I would love to play for KKR if they build a women's IPL team." She added, "It would be great if they select most of their players from Bengal." The inaugural edition of women's IPL is scheduled to begin early next year.

335.title: Sonali's family writes to CJI for CBI probe, says 'Goa Police not supporting'
335.article_body: Haryana BJP leader and TikTok star Sonali Phogat's family has written a letter to the Chief Justice of India for a CBI probe into her death. "Goa Police is not supporting us...I think political influence is also behind this," her nephew Vikas Singh said. He added they are also waiting for the answer whatever comes from the Supreme Court.

336.title: Injured MP woman carried to hospital on cot for 6 km due to lack of road
336.article_body: Family members of a woman, who was injured due to electrocution, allegedly carried her on a cot for six kilometres to reach the nearest health centre in the absence of a road in a tribal area in Madhya Pradesh's Seoni. "I'll visit Bakharimal village...to take stock of the situation and to ensure easy transportation for the villagers," Ghansor SDM said.

337.title: I really like Rohit as a leader, batter: Waqar Younis
337.article_body: Former Pakistan skipper Waqar Younis said that he really likes Indian skipper Rohit Sharma "as a leader as well as a batter". "It's not that he (Rohit) is playing bad shots. Just that sometimes you aren't able to execute the right shots properly and that's why you end up getting dismissed," Younis said.

338.title: Indian economy will see double-digit growth this fiscal: Sitharaman
338.article_body: Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Saturday said the Indian economy would see double-digit growth this fiscal. "We (India) have zero percent chance of slipping into recession. I hope for double-digit growth...We are literally the fastest growing economy," the Finance Minister said. Notably, India is currently the fifth largest economy in the world.

339.title: Road crashes claimed 1.55 lakh lives in India in 2021, about 18 lives per hour: Data
339.article_body: Over 1.55 lakh lives were lost in road crashes across India in 2021, marking an average of 426 daily or 18 every single hour. According to government data, this is the highest death figure recorded in any year so far. Besides the deaths, 3.71 lakh people were injured in 4.03 lakh 'road accidents' in India last year, NCRB data revealed.

340.title: Remains of woman believed to be a 'vampire' found in Poland, pics show sickle across neck
340.article_body: The 17th-century remains of a woman who was believed to be a vampire were found by archaeologists in Poland. The skeletal remains were found with a sickle placed across her neck to prevent her from 'rising from the dead', said an archaeologist. A padlock was also seen around the toe of the female who was given an 'anti-vampire' burial.

341.title: Ravi Shastri makes blunder during toss for India-Pakistan match, video goes viral
341.article_body: A video has gone viral on social media showing Ravi Shastri making a blunder during the toss for India-Pakistan Super 4 stage match in Asia Cup 2022. After India captain Rohit Sharma spun the coin, Babar Azam called 'tails', however Ravi Shastri said in the mic, "Heads is the call," after which the match referee looked confused.

342.title: 17 years ago, I played you and now, I'm interviewing you: Blake to Nadal
342.article_body: Following Rafael Nadal's third round win at US Open 2022, ex-tennis player James Blake tweeted, "17 years ago, I played you on Arthur Ashe Stadium and now I'm interviewing you because you're still one of, if not the, greatest in the world." In the third round at US Open 2005, wildcard Blake beat second seed Nadal 6-4, 4-6, 6-3, 6-1.

343.title: Means a lot to help youngsters: Bumrah on his time at NCA
343.article_body: Indian pacer Jasprit Bumrah commented on his ongoing rehab stint at the National Cricket Academy (NCA) in Bengaluru. "Not long ago, I was on the other side, learning, observing and grasping everything I could," Bumrah said. He added, "Which is why it means a lot...to be able to use the knowledge I have today to help youngsters along the way."

344.title: Bed Bath & Beyond CFO jumps from 18th floor days after announcing job cuts, dies
344.article_body: Gustavo Arnal, the CFO of Bed Bath & Beyond, died after he jumped from the 18th floor of a skyscraper in New York City on Friday, police confirmed. The incident occurred days after the US-based retailer announced plans to lay off 20% of its staff and close several stores. Last month, the 52-year-old executive sold company shares worth $1 million.

345.title: 28-yr-old Karni Sena leader Rohit Rajput stabbed to death in MP, murder caught on camera
345.article_body: A 28-year-old Karni Sena leader named Rohit Singh Rajput was stabbed to death in front of a municipality office in Itarsi area of MP's Narmadapuram district on Friday night. Rajput and his friend were standing in the main market area when three men on motorcycles approached them, leading to a fight. A video the crime has surfaced on social media.

346.title: 2 Odisha forest dept officials suspended after elephant electrocuted
346.article_body: Two officials of the Odisha State Forest Department were suspended on Sunday over dereliction of duty a day after a 10-year-old female elephant was found electrocuted in a village. "Had they been alert, the elephant wouldn't have died of electrocution from the hanging live wire that was set up for [a] wild boar," Dhenkanal DFO Prakash Chand Gogineni said.

347.title: We each stick to our own opinions: Pallavi on political differences with Vivek
347.article_body: Actress Pallavi Joshi spoke about how she deals with political differences with her filmmaker-husband Vivek Agnihotri. "Sometimes we come on the same page. Sometimes we don't. And we each stick to our own opinions," she said. "We're fine with it. We're two individuals and every morning, when we...sit in...living room, we've...tea together, but we don't drink from...same cup," Pallavi added.

348.title: India record their highest-ever score in powerplay in a T20I against Pakistan
348.article_body: India scored 62/1 in the first six overs against Pakistan on Sunday, their highest-ever score in a powerplay in a T20I against Pakistan. Rohit Sharma and KL Rahul slammed a combined 4 fours and 4 sixes in the powerplay. India's previous highest score in a powerplay in a T20I match against Pakistan was 48/1, scored in Ahmedabad in 2012.

349.title: I'm yet to find someone who praised the film: Prakash on 'Laal...'
349.article_body: Filmmaker Prakash Jha has said that it's not the boycott trend that has affected the box office performance of Aamir Khan's 'Laal Singh Chaddha'.
