He added that a majority of those who have seen it aren't praising it. "I am yet to find someone who has said, 'Wow, what a film it was'," Prakash further said.

350.title: Kvitova saves 2 match points, beats Muguruza to reach last 16 at US Open
350.article_body: Czech Petra Kvitova saved two match points before making a third set comeback to defeat ninth seed Garbine Muguruza and reach the last 16 at US Open 2022 on Saturday. The 21st seed trailed 2-5 before levelling the third set 5-5 and forced a super-tiebreak to win the match 5-7, 6-3, 7-6(12-10) in two hours 38 minutes.

351.title: Hope more talent joins the profession: President on Teacher's Day eve
351.article_body: President Droupadi Murmu on Sunday extended her greetings on the eve of Teacher's Day. She said she hopes that more talent joins the profession. "Our teachers are continuously trying to improve their capabilities and proficiency through new research, experiments and innovations," an official statement from Rashtrapati Bhavan said quoting President Murmu.

352.title: Courts expected to play role of Oppn in certain cases: Ex-CJI Ramana
352.article_body: Former CJI NV Ramana said courts should be dispassionate and in certain situations, they are expected to play the role of or supplant the Opposition. He added that the courts have played an important role in ensuring that constitutional rights are not a dead letter. Ramana said the 1960s and 1970s were the most challenging periods in modern Indian history.

353.title: Pak captain Babar trolled for 'Play confidentially' message to his team for India match
353.article_body: Pakistan captain Babar Azam was asked during the toss by Ravi Shastri about what his message to his team is for match against India. Babar responded, "Play confidentially." Babar was trolled for his response, with a fan tweeting, "Not sure if it's cricket or what." Another wrote, "I hope they play confidentially." "What a start to the match," tweeted another.

354.title: Goa Police visits residence of Sonali Phogat's personal assistant for investigation
354.article_body: The Goa Police, as part of their investigation into BJP leader Sonali Phogat's death, visited her personal assistant Sudhir Sangwan's house in Rohtak, Haryana. The team, after making enquiries at the residence, then reportedly left for Gurugram. It is the fifth day of Goa Police's investigation in Haryana with the team reaching Hisar on Wednesday to visit Phogat's farmhouse.

355.title: If there are fielding restrictions, then no one is as dangerous as Pant: Waqar
355.article_body: Former Pakistan pacer, Waqar Younis said that having wicketkeeper-batter Rishabh Pant on the bench is a "luxury for India". "All of us...were shocked at how he (Pant) is not playing [in India-Pak match]. I personally feel he is best suited in the top-order," Waqar said. He added, "If there are fielding restrictions, there is no one as dangerous as him."

356.title: Does BJP's SOP include barging into ATC Control Rooms?: TMC MP
356.article_body: TMC MP Mahua Moitra asked on Twitter if the "BJP's SOP for bringing down Opposition...now [includes] barging into ATC Control Rooms?" Moitra was referring to BJP MPs Nishikant Dubey and Manoj Tiwari being booked for reportedly pressuring authorities at Jharkhand's Deoghar airport to clear their chartered jet for a nighttime takeoff. Moitra said she knew "BJP's SOP...involves chartered planes".

357.title: Among the best business minds of his generation, called away too soon: Adani on Mistry
357.article_body: Adani Group Chairman Gautam Adani on Sunday said he was shocked and saddened to hear about the death of 54-year-old former Tata Sons Chairman Cyrus Mistry. "One of the finest gentlemen I've known, he was one of the best business minds of his generation," said Adani on Mistry. "It's a tragic loss. He was called away too soon," Adani added.

358.title: Cyrus Mistry's death shocking, loss for entire business world: Maha CM
358.article_body: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde on Sunday condoled the death of former Tata Sons Chairman Cyrus Mistry, saying it was not just a loss for his family but for the entire business world. Mistry was not just a successful industrialist, but a young and visionary entrepreneur as the business world looked up to him with hope, CM Shinde added.

359.title: Emraan Hashmi to star in Karan Johar’s OTT series: Reports
359.article_body: Emraan Hashmi will reportedly star in Karan Johar's upcoming production venture, which will be helmed by Mihir Desai and Archit Kumar. The suspense-drama series is slated to go on floors this year and will stream on an OTT platform. The series will also reportedly feature an ensemble of actors. The makers are yet to share details on the project.

360.title: GST officers can initiate proceedings in cases of over ₹5 cr evasion
360.article_body: The Finance Ministry has clarified that GST officials can initiate legal proceedings against offenders in cases where the amount of evasion is more than ₹5 crore. It added that the ₹5 crore limit would not apply in the case of a company/taxpayer habitually involved in tax evasion, misusing Input Tax Credit (ITC) facility or fraudulently obtained refund.

361.title: Maha Deputy CM Fadnavis orders probe into accident that claimed Cyrus Mistry’s life
361.article_body: Maharashtra Deputy Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis on Sunday said he has asked police to conduct a detailed investigation into the accident that claimed the life of former Tata Sons chairman Cyrus Mistry. A senior Mumbai police official had said the car in which Mistry was travelling had rammed into a divider on a bridge on the Surya river.

362.title: Kartik Aaryan signs director Anurag Basu's upcoming romantic film: Reports
362.article_body: Actor Kartik Aaryan has reportedly signed director Anurag Basu's upcoming romantic film. A source told Bollywood Hungama that the film is one of a kind of love story that hasn't been seen in Hindi cinema before. "Anurag Basu's film will give Kartik a chance to extend his performing skills beyond anything he has done so far," the source added.

363.title: 63 pistols seized, 3 arms suppliers arrested by Punjab Police in MP
363.article_body: Punjab Police has arrested three illegal arms suppliers and seized 63 country-made pistols from the latter's possession in Madhya Pradesh's Khargone, an officer said. According to him, 24 cases were earlier registered against the three accused, who used to supply pistols in Punjab and Rajasthan, among other states. Two other persons were arrested last month with four pistols, he added.

364.title: Cyrus was amongst brightest business minds in the country: Rahul
364.article_body: Congress MP Rahul Gandhi condoled the death of former chairperson of the Tata Group, Cyrus Mistry, who passed away in a road accident near Mumbai on Sunday. "Saddened by the tragic news...He (Mistry) was amongst the brightest business minds in the country, who made a significant contribution to India's growth story. My heartfelt condolences to his family," Rahul tweeted.

365.title: Thunderous rainfall across Karnataka till September 9: IMD
365.article_body: The IMD has predicted thunderous rainfall across Karnataka, especially Bengaluru, three coastal districts and hilly areas till September 9. Heavy rains are expected for Monday in Bengaluru while a yellow alert has been issued for Kodagu, Shivamogga, Udupi and other districts. Thousands of houses across the state capital have been inundated as CM Basavaraj Bommai visits flood-affected localities.

366.title: Paytm denies links to Chinese loan merchants being probed by ED after raids
366.article_body: Paytm parent entity One97 Communications on Sunday denied having links with the loan merchants that are under investigation by ED in the Chinese loan app case. It said the merchants were "independent entities", a day after ED raided Paytm's Bengaluru office and announced the freezing of some funds. Paytm said the funds frozen by ED don't belong to it.

367.title: Compensate family of those who died of COVID vaccine after-effects: HC
367.article_body: The Kerala High Court has asked the National Disaster Management Authority (NDMA) to frame a policy for identifying and compensating the dependents of those who died due to the after-effects of the COVID-19 vaccine. "Even if the numbers are very few, there are instances where people are suspected to have succumbed to the after-effects of immunisation," the court said.

368.title: India announce their playing XI for Asia Cup Super 4 match against Pakistan
368.article_body: Pakistan captain Babar Azam won the toss and elected to bowl first in their Asia Cup 2022 Super 4 stage match against India. India all-rounder Hardik Pandya, who was rested against Hong Kong, has been included in the playing XI. Deepak Hooda and Ravi Bishnoi have also been included in the playing XI.

369.title: SRK didn't answer, jokes Hasan Minhaj as he poses in front of Mannat
369.article_body: American comedian-actor Hasan Minhaj took to Instagram to share a picture of himself posing outside the gate of Shah Rukh Khan's Mumbai bungalow Mannat. "Pulled up to Shah Rukh's. He didn't answer tho," he jokingly wrote. Reacting to his post, a fan wrote, "Of course you did Hasan. Of course you did. It's part of...India tour...It has to be done."

370.title: Woman sets self on fire in MP, alleges police inaction on rape complaint
370.article_body: A 26-year-old woman sustained severe burns, as she set herself on fire after the police allegedly failed to register a case based on her complaint of rape in MP's Shahdol, an official said on Sunday. The woman is undergoing treatment in a hospital, while Amlai police station in-charge Mohammed Sameer and sub-inspector Savitri Singh have been relieved of their duties.

371.title: Ex-Kerala Minister Shailaja declines to accept Magsaysay Award
371.article_body: Former Kerala Health Minister KK Shailaja has said that she was considered for the Ramon Magsaysay Award for 2022, but she declined to accept it after holding talks with her party, CPI(M). She said, "Magsaysay (former Philippines President) had been anti-communist. I was considered for the award as an individual." She said she has communicated her decision to them.

372.title: Rahul Gandhi says 'Atta cost ₹22/litre in 2014, it now costs ₹40/litre', video goes viral
372.article_body: During the 'Halla Bol' rally, Congress' Rahul Gandhi, while comparing prices of daily use items, said, "Atta (flour) used to cost ₹22 per litre in 2014, it now costs ₹40 per litre." Gandhi, who immediately corrected himself, was trolled online. Reacting to trolling, Congress shared a video of his speech and wrote, "Leave 'litre', take care of the public."

373.title: Versova police take Kamaal R Khan's custody for allegedly molesting actress in 2019
373.article_body: Actor Kamaal R Khan, who was in judicial custody over a controversial tweet posted by him in 2020, has now been taken into custody by Versova police for allegedly molesting an actress in 2019. The actress, in her police complaint, had said that Khan molested her at his house after promising her the lead role in a Hindi movie.

374.title: Haryana man hires UP gang to rob daughter's house, 4 arrested
374.article_body: A man named Sandeep Singh in Haryana hired a gang of three robbers from Uttar Pradesh to carry out a theft in his married daughter's house, police said. Police said the robbers decamped with ₹4 lakh cash and jewellery by taking her mother-in-law hostage at gunpoint. The accused Sandeep Singh, Pankaj Kumar, Kapil and Sompal were arrested by the police.

375.title: I'm told his real name is Aslam, why hide it: Kangana on Mahesh Bhatt
375.article_body: Actress Kangana Ranaut took to her Instagram Stories on Sunday to share an old video of filmmaker Mahesh Bhatt and wrote, "I am told his real name is Aslam." "He converted to marry his second wife...it is a beautiful name, why hide it?" she added. Kangana made her debut with 'Gangster', which was backed by Mahesh Bhatt.

376.title: NGO involved in Karnataka seer case seeks police protection
376.article_body: Mysuru NGO Odanadi Seva Samsthe, which had filed a complaint against Lingayat Chitradurga math's head seer, has asked the police for protection. The NGO founders said math supporters called them several times and they fear for their lives. Two girls of the math had approached the NGO and alleged that head seer Shivamurthy Murugha Sharanaru sexually assaulted them for years.

377.title: Credit to Manmohan, Narasimha govts for India overtaking UK's GDP: Basu
377.article_body: Ex-Chief Economist of the World Bank, Kaushik Basu commented after India surpassed the UK to become the world's fifth-largest economy. "If anyone gets credit for India overtaking UK's GDP, it's Narasimha Rao & Manmohan Singh's governments," Basu tweeted. He added, "India's growth spurt from 1994 & even faster growth from 2005 made this inevitable, despite the sharp slowdown since 2016."

378.title: CBI raids homes of TMC MLA Subodh Adhikari, brother in chit fund scam
378.article_body: The Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) on Sunday raided the residences of TMC MLA Subodh Adhikari and his brother Kamal Adhikari in connection with the chit fund scam, in which people were cheated of lakhs of rupees, officials said. Kamal Adhikari is also the chairman of the Kanchrapara Municipality. The CBI raided seven locations in West Bengal on Sunday.

379.title: 50-yr-old man sexually assaults stepdaughter for 5 yrs in Pune, held
379.article_body: The Pune Police on Saturday arrested a 50-year-old man for sexually harassing his 19-year-old stepdaughter for the past five years, officials said. According to the complaint filed by the girl, the accused used abusive language and clicked naked pictures of her, said SB Kadam, police sub-inspector at Sangvi police station, adding that he also followed her to college.

380.title: Launching soon: Peyush on video of cart made by Shark Tank's Jugadu Kamlesh
380.article_body: Lenskart Co-founder and Shark Tank India's judge Peyush Bansal took to Instagram to share a video of a cart for agricultural purposes made by the show's contestant Jugadu Kamlesh. "Launching soon...Bharat K2 - Motorised, Adjustable, Easy to Use, Affordable," Bansal captioned the video. During the show, Bansal offered Kamlesh ₹10 lakh for 40% equity and a ₹20 lakh loan.

381.title: Really tragic Cyrus passed away at such a young age: Tata Sons' Chandrasekaran
381.article_body: Tata Sons Chairman N Chandrasekaran condoled the death of former Tata Sons Chairman Cyrus Mistry, who passed away at the age of 54 in a car accident near Mumbai. "He had a passion for life and it's really tragic that he passed away at such a young age," N Chandrasekaran said. "I'm deeply saddened by his untimely demise," he added.

382.title: Who was driving the car that met with an accident in Maharashtra, killing Cyrus Mistry?
382.article_body: Former Tata Sons chairman Cyrus Mistry was killed after his car hit a divider in Maharashtra. There were four people in the car and Anahita Pandole, a top doctor at Breach Candy Hospital, was driving the vehicle, police said. Anahita and Darius Pandole, the CEO of JM Financial Private Equity, were injured, while another person named Jahangir Pandole was killed.

383.title: Don't miss this contest within contest: Kaif ahead of India-Pak Asia Cup game
383.article_body: Mohammad Kaif took to Twitter ahead of India-Pakistan Super 4 stage match at Asia Cup and wrote, "There are many reasons to watch today's game. For me it's India's top three vs raw Pakistan pace." He added, "Rohit Sharma, KL Rahul, [and] Virat Kohli can tackle speed but with young Pakistan speedsters you never know. Don't miss this contest within...contest."

384.title: KL's role is to anchor innings; just needs couple of more boundaries: Kaif
384.article_body: Former India cricketer Mohammad Kaif said that batter KL Rahul's role is to "anchor" the innings. "Rahul is an outstanding player and doesn't need to change a lot of things...He just needs to score a couple of more boundaries in the powerplay," Kaif said. He added, "Rohit [Sharma] is looking to score quickly so that Rahul can play his game."

385.title: I try to stay in my zone, play the game: Suryakumar ahead of India-Pak game
385.article_body: Talking about his preparations ahead of the Super 4 stage match against Pakistan at Asia Cup 2022, India batter Suryakumar Yadav said, "I just try to stay in my zone...play the game." He added that there have been a lot of talks regarding the India-Pakistan match, with people saying it's the greatest rivalry, but it's like playing just another match.

386.title: 2-year-old girl dies of snakebite in Thane after delay in treatment
386.article_body: A two-year-old girl bitten by a snake died after she allegedly could not get timely treatment in Maharashtra's Thane district. The incident took place on Saturday, following which the girl was taken to the Temba health centre, reports said. The centre is not equipped to handle emergency cases and the girl needed special care, a medical officer said.

387.title: Trump says Zuckerberg came to White House for dinner with him 'last week'; trolled
387.article_body: Former US President Donald Trump was trolled after he claimed Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg came to the White House for dinner last week. "The weirdo...kissed my a** all night...'Sir, you're number one on Facebook. I'd like to congratulate you'," Trump said on Saturday. Twitter users pointed out that Trump left White House in 2021 and that he's suspended from Facebook.

388.title: Give money or else: Video of Kerala boy assaulting family for cash goes viral
388.article_body: A video of a Kerala teen assaulting his family members and demanding money has gone viral on the internet. In the video, which was shot by an onlooker, the boy can be seen yelling and thrashing the windows of his house. The boy can also be seen kicking an old woman and throwing slippers at another.

389.title: I only met Cyrus Mistry once, he was all dignity and class: Harsha Bhogle
389.article_body: Cricket commentator Harsha Bhogle on Sunday condoled the death of former Tata Sons chairman Cyrus Mistry and tweeted, "I only met Cyrus Mistry once. He was all dignity and class." He added, "Can't believe he is gone." Mistry, 54, passed away on Sunday in a road accident near Mumbai after his car hit a divider.

390.title: Shocked & saddened: Vedanta's Anil Agarwal on  Cyrus Mistry's demise
390.article_body: Vedanta's Chairman Anil Agarwal on Sunday condoled the demise of former Tata Sons Chairman Cyrus Mistry. Taking to Twitter, Agarwal said, "Corporate India has lost a promising son. Shocked and saddened to hear of the untimely demise of Cyrus Mistry. Deepest condolences to his family." Mistry passed away aged 54 in a road accident near Mumbai on Sunday.

391.title: Cong is oblivious; has no vision, policy & no leadership: BJP
391.article_body: The BJP on Sunday mocked the Congress rally against the price rise, saying that the party is oblivious to ground realities, adding that the party has no vision, no policy and no leadership. Congress has lost 90% of elections since 2014, said BJP national spokesperson Rajyavardhan Singh Rathore. Congress' rally is an attempt at relaunching Rahul Gandhi, he added.

392.title: Ashok Chavan denies joining BJP, calls reports 'baseless'
392.article_body: Senior Congress leader Ashok Chavan on Saturday denied rumours of him joining BJP and called them baseless. “I am in Delhi now and will be attending the Bharat Jodo rally in Ramlila Maidan. All the speculations about me joining the BJP are baseless. I just happened to be at Ashish Kulkarni’s place when he (Fadnavis) arrived,” Chavan said.

393.title: PM Modi condoles Cyrus Mistry's death, says 'big loss to world of commerce & industry'
393.article_body: PM Narendra Modi expressed his condolences after the demise of former Tata Sons Chairman Cyrus Mistry. He wrote, "The untimely demise of Shri Cyrus Mistry is shocking. He was a promising business leader who believed in India's economic prowess. His passing away is a big loss to the world of commerce and industry...May his soul rest in peace."

394.title: Aditya's 'Come...' gets standing ovation at US theatre; Vishal shares video
394.article_body: Filmmaker Aditya Chopra's Broadway musical 'Come Fall In Love', based on his 1995 film 'Dilwale Dulhania Le Jayenge', received a standing ovation from the audience at The Old Globe theatre in San Diego, US. Musical duo Vishal-Sheykhar, composers of 'Come Fall In Love', shared a video on their respective Instagram handles. "Feeling proud as an Indian," Sheykhar wrote.

395.title: Jammu-Srinagar National Highway reopens for light vehicles
395.article_body: The Jammu-Srinagar National Highway reopened for light vehicles going towards Kashmir on Sunday. The highway was blocked at Udhampur due to shooting stones and landslides in the Ramban area after heavy rainfall. Several roadways were waterlogged and commuters were stuck in various parts of Jammu and Kashmir due to rains.

396.title: Vice President urges media to make people aware of organ donation
396.article_body: Vice President Jagdeep Dhankhar urged religious leaders and media to create awareness about organ donation. “Media and social media have a great role in this mission. Every media person must contribute to spreading this well-meaning message,” Dhankhar said. He also called organ donation a sensitive issue and emphasised the need for creating a support system for donation.

397.title: Cyrus Mistry, who died in a road accident today, lost his father Pallonji Mistry 2 months ago
397.article_body: Former Tata Sons Chairman Cyrus Mistry, who passed away in a road accident on Sunday, lost his father and construction tycoon, Pallonji Mistry, two months ago. Cyrus passed away aged 54 in a road accident on Sunday near Mumbai after his car hit a divider. Shapoorji Pallonji Group's head, Pallonji Mistry, passed away in late June aged 93 in Mumbai.

398.title: Hard to digest this news: Mahindra after Cyrus Mistry killed in road accident
398.article_body: Businessman Anand Mahindra condoled the demise of former Tata Sons Chairman Cyrus Mistry. He tweeted, "Hard to digest this news. I got to know Cyrus...during his...tenure as the head of the House of Tata. I was convinced he was destined for greatness. If life had other plans for him, so be it, but life itself shouldn't have been snatched...from him."

399.title: Had brotherly love for Irrfan, we used to play for 3 hrs like children: Deepak
399.article_body: Actor Deepak Dobriyal said in an interview that he had "brotherly love" for late actor Irrfan Khan, with whom he worked in 'Hindi Medium' and 'Angrezi Medium'. "We would spend a lot of time together; his hotel room was next to mine," he added. Deepak further said they used to play for three hours "like children" in the evening.

400.title: RJD leader Vijendra Yadav killed in Bihar's Rohtas district
400.article_body: RJD leader Vijendra Yadav was shot dead on Saturday near Nimdihara Road in Rohtas district in Bihar. According to reports, he was going for farming work when six bike-riding criminals opened fire at him. "One bullet hit the head and one hit the neck due to which he died on the spot," said the police.

401.title: Deeply anguished by sudden passing away of Cyrus Mistry: Piyush Goyal
401.article_body: Union Minister of Commerce and Industry Piyush Goyal on Sunday condoled the demise of former Tata Sons Chairman Cyrus Mistry. Taking to Twitter, Goyal said, "Deeply anguished [and] shocked by the sudden passing away of Cyrus Mistry." "Indian industry has lost one of its shining stars whose contributions to India's economic progress will always be remembered," he tweeted.
